analyzed: kun dga' bo ci'i phyir dge slong dgon pa pa dag gis dgon pa'i gnas mal dag bor te /

translated: “Lord, since the Lord has laid down for the monks training rules like this in the Monastic Law, the monks who live in the wilderness are unable to receive the water and tooth cleaners. They have abandoned the wilderness dwellings

original: grong mtha'i gnas mal dag tu zhugs so //
analyzed: grong mtha'i gnas mal dag tu zhugs so //
translated: and entered the dwellings on the outskirts of town.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The Buddha said,

analyzed: de lta bas na chu dang so shing ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, except for water and tooth cleaners,🔽There were tame elephants, tame monkeys, and tame bears. They offered fruit to the monks, but the monks, being scrupulous, did not accept it. The Buddha said,

original: glang po che cang shes dang spre'u cang shes dang dom cang shes dag yod nas de dag gis dge slong rnams la shing tog dag 'bul ba na dge slong rnams 'gyod pas de dag mi len nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: gang la len pa yod pa de la stobs pa yang yod pas de dag gis bstabs pa ni byin len byas par brjod par bya ste /

original: de la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not regret it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having spoken in praise of desiring the training, of respect for the training, and of austerity with regard to the training,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: having given a talk on the Dharma that was consistent with that, that was mostly consistent with that, and that was appropriate for that,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore the former was a rule, but this is an exception:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab @234a *//
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab @234a *//
translated: My disciples should recite this basis of training in the Monastic Law like this:

analyzed: pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste yang dge slong gang ma byin par kha nas mid pa'i zas za na chu dang so shing ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: ‘If a monk eats food that has not been given, except for water and tooth cleaners, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽ma byin par zhes bya ba ni de la skyes pa'am bud med dam /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // ma byin par zhes bya ba ni de la skyes pa'am bud med dam /
translated: “A monk” means a monk who is one of the group of six or another who is similar.

original: ma ning gang dag gis kyang ma byin par ro //
analyzed: ma ning gang dag gis kyang ma byin par ro //
translated: “Without having been given” means that it has not been given by a man or a woman or a neuter.

original: kha nas mid pa'i zas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha nas mid pa'i zas zhes bya ba ni /

original: bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go /
translated: means the five kinds of food that are chewed and the five kinds of food that are eaten.

original: za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “If he eats it” means if he swallows it.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni chu dang so shing bzhag ste'o //🔽ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni chu dang so shing bzhag ste'o // ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Except for water and tooth cleaners” means except for water and tooth cleaners.🔽“Offense of wrong conduct” means that which burns,

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: boils, and causes one to fall into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of hungry ghosts—into bad migrations, bad destinies, and downward-leading paths.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense has not been confessed and has not been properly confessed, it is an obscuration to wholesome dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “defeat.”

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽dge slong gis byin len ma byas pa la byin len ma byas par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / dge slong gis byin len ma byas pa la byin len ma byas par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the downfall?🔽If a monk, without having received it, perceives that he has not received it, and he eats the food, he commits a downfall.

original: dge slong gis byin len ma byas pa la yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis byin len byas pa la byin len ma byas par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba @234b 'cha' 'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis byin len ma byas pa la yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis byin len byas pa la byin len ma byas par 'du shes pas bca' ba dang bza' ba @234b 'cha' 'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, without having received it, is unsure of whether he has received it, and he eats the food, he commits a downfall.🔽If a monk, having received it, perceives that he has not received it, and he eats the food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis byin len byas pa la yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis byin len byas pa la yid gnyis za bas bca' ba dang bza' ba 'cha'am za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, having received it, is unsure of whether he has received it, and he eats the food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dge slong rnams kyis zhus pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dge slong rnams kyis zhus pa /
translated: The monks asked the Buddha,

analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen pos las ci bgyis na las de'i rnam par smin pas /
translated: “Lord, what action did the venerable Mahākāśyapa take that ripened into his going forth in the presence of the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu byung nas thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis shing dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas yang dag pa ma lags pas skur bar gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu byung nas thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du bgyis shing dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas yang dag pa ma lags pas skur bar gyur /
translated: and that he attained arhatship, having abandoned all afflictions, and then falsely slandered the Bhagavān?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu nag po chen po nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag byas shing bsags pas nag po chen po nyid kyis las byas shing🔽bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong dag rigs kyi bu nag po chen po nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag byas shing bsags pas nag po chen po nyid kyis las byas shing🔽bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur /
translated: “Monks, the son of good family Mahākāśyapa himself performed and accumulated actions whose collection was attained, whose conditions were transformed, whose radiance was like that of fire, and which were certain to come.🔽There is no doubt that Mahākāśyapa himself performed and accumulated those actions.

original: dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Monks, karma that is done and accumulated does not ripen upon the external elements of earth,

original: chu'i khams la mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chu'i khams la mi 'gyur /
translated: water,

original: me'i khams la mi 'gyur /
analyzed: me'i khams la mi 'gyur /
translated: fire,

original: rlung gi khams la mi 'gyur gyi 'di ltar las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa dag ni zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung gi khams la mi 'gyur gyi 'di ltar las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa dag ni zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag la rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: or wind. Rather, the virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that is done and accumulated ripens upon the appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: @235a *// las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //🔽chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus //🔽rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
analyzed: @235a *// las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni // chud mi za ba'ang tshogs dang dus // rnyed na lus can rnams la ni //
translated: Karma does not perish even after a hundred eons.🔽When the conditions and time are right,

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: it will ripen upon embodied beings.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: Monks, in the past,

original: grong khyer w'a ra n'a sir rang sangs rgyas bla ma zhes bya ba zhig nye bar rten cing gnas pa de lha'i tshogs 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te dur khrod chen po'i dbus nas w'a ra n'a sir bsod snyoms la zhugs so
analyzed: grong khyer w'a ra n'a sir rang sangs rgyas bla ma zhes bya ba zhig nye bar rten cing gnas pa de lha'i tshogs 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te dur khrod chen po'i dbus nas w'a ra n'a sir bsod snyoms la zhugs so
translated: In the city of Vārāṇasī, a pratyekabuddha named Guru was living nearby. Surrounded and honored by hundreds of thousands of hosts of gods, he entered Vārāṇasī for alms in the middle of the great charnel ground.

original: // dur khrod chen po de na gnod sbyin gdug pa zhig 'dug pa de de na mi ro myags pa za'o //
analyzed: // dur khrod chen po de na gnod sbyin gdug pa zhig 'dug pa de de na mi ro myags pa za'o //
translated: In that great charnel ground, there was a fierce yakṣa who lived there, eating the rotting corpses of humans.

original: gang gi tshe rang sangs rgyas bla ma dur khrod chen po der phyin pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang sangs rgyas bla ma dur khrod chen po der phyin pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the pratyekabuddha Guru arrived at that great charnel ground,

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa de lha'i mthus dur khrod chen po de nas bros pa dang / de'i mi ro myags pa de dag wa la sogs pas zos nas /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa de lha'i mthus dur khrod chen po de nas bros pa dang / de'i mi ro myags pa de dag wa la sogs pas zos nas /
translated: by the power of the gods, the fierce yakṣa fled from that great charnel ground, and the rotting corpses of humans were eaten by foxes and so forth.

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa des bsams pa /
translated: The fierce yakṣa thought,

original: rab tu byung ba 'di bdag gi lto'i gegs su gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di bdag gi lto'i gegs su gyur gyi /
translated: This renunciant has become an obstacle to my food.

original: bdag gis 'di la bsnyen bkur ma yin pa bya'o snyam nas des de'i lhung bzed du mi'i lag pa bcug pa dang / w'a ra n'a si thams cad du rab tu byung ba de mi sha za'o zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la bsnyen bkur ma yin pa bya'o snyam nas des de'i lhung bzed du mi'i lag pa bcug pa dang / w'a ra n'a si thams cad du rab tu byung ba de mi sha za'o zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
translated: “I will not show him respect.” He put his hand into the monk’s begging bowl, and the word went out all over Vārāṇasī that the monk was a cannibal.

original: rang sangs rgyas bdag nyid chen po des bsams pa /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas bdag nyid chen po des bsams pa /
translated: The great being, the solitary buddha, thought,

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa nyon mongs pa 'di ha cang smras pa dang nyams par gyur na mi rung gi /🔽'di lta lag nas drang ba sbyin no snyam nas de de la snying brtse ba'i phyir des ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa ltar @235b steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas 'bar ba dang gsal ba dang char 'bab pa dang glog 'byin pa'i cho
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa nyon mongs pa 'di ha cang smras pa dang nyams par gyur na mi rung gi / 'di lta lag nas drang ba sbyin no snyam nas de de la snying brtse ba'i phyir des ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa ltar @235b steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas 'bar ba dang gsal ba dang char 'bab pa dang glog 'byin pa'i cho
translated: “It would not be right for this wicked yakṣa to be destroyed because of his excessive boasting.

original: 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams so //
analyzed: 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams so //
translated: I will give him a gift that will be taken from my own hand.” Out of compassion for him, he rose up into the sky like the king of swans stretching out his wings, and he performed the miracles of blazing with fire, radiating light, causing rain to fall, and causing lightning to strike.

original: so so'i skye bo ni rdzu 'phrul la myur du sems gtod par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni rdzu 'phrul la myur du sems gtod par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Ordinary beings are quick to focus their minds on miracles.

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa de shing ljon pa rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin du rang sangs rgyas de'i rkang pa gnyis kyi drung du 'gyel nas smras pa /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa de shing ljon pa rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin du rang sangs rgyas de'i rkang pa gnyis kyi drung du 'gyel nas smras pa /
translated: The evil yakṣa fell at the feet of the solitary buddha like a tree cut at the root and said,

original: yon gnas yang dag par gyur pa mar gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: yon gnas yang dag par gyur pa mar gshegs su gsol /
translated: “Please come down, you who are worthy of offerings!

original: mar gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: mar gshegs su gsol /
translated: Please come down!

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dam du bying ba bdag gi sug pa nas drang ba stsal du gsol /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dam du bying ba bdag gi sug pa nas drang ba stsal du gsol /
translated: Please pull me out of the swamp of afflictions by the hand!”

original: bdag gis khyed la yang dag pa ma lags pa'i bsngags pa ma lags pa brjod do //
analyzed: bdag gis khyed la yang dag pa ma lags pa'i bsngags pa ma lags pa brjod do //
translated: “I spoke ill of you with false praise!”

original: w'a ra n'a si thams cad du yang rab tu byung ba de mi sha mi za yi /
analyzed: w'a ra n'a si thams cad du yang rab tu byung ba de mi sha mi za yi /
translated: “In all of Vārāṇasī it is well known that this renunciant does not eat human flesh.

original: 'dis de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis de la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mi bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: He spoke ill of you with false praise.”

original: zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
analyzed: zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
translated: Thus the news spread.

original: rang sangs rgyas de gnod sbyin gdug pa de la rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de gnod sbyin gdug pa de la rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir /
translated: Out of compassion for the evil yakṣa, the solitary buddha

original: steng gi nam mkha' las shod du babs so //
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' las shod du babs so //
translated: descended from the sky to the ground.

original: de nas gnod sbyin gdug pa des de'i lhung bzed nas /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin gdug pa des de'i lhung bzed nas /
translated: Then the evil yakṣa,

original: mi'i lag pa sa la bor te rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas smon lam 'di skad ces bdag yon gnas yang dag par gyur pa 'di lta bu la gnod pa byas pa gang yin pa'i las de'i cha dang mthun par ma gyur bar mchod pa byas pa
analyzed: mi'i lag pa sa la bor te rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas smon lam 'di skad ces bdag yon gnas yang dag par gyur pa 'di lta bu la gnod pa byas pa gang yin pa'i las de'i cha dang mthun par ma gyur bar mchod pa byas pa
translated: “By this root of merit of making offerings to such a pure object of offering, may I not experience even a portion of the karma of having harmed him.

original: gang yin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis 'dri bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed cing thugs byung bar mi @236a *//
analyzed: gang yin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis 'dri bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed cing thugs byung bar mi @236a *//
translated: By this root of merit of making offerings to such a pure object of offering, may I please and not displease a teacher who is even more exalted than the one I have now.

original: byed pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa de lta bu thob par gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: byed pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa de lta bu thob par gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: May I attain such qualities.”

original: dge slong dag de la de'i dus na gnod sbyin gdug pa gang yin pa de ni nag po chen po 'di yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la de'i dus na gnod sbyin gdug pa gang yin pa de ni nag po chen po 'di yin te /
translated: “Monks, the evil yakṣa at that time, on that occasion, was indeed this Mahākāla.

original: des rang sangs rgyas la yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa btab pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas tshe rabs mang po dag tu sems can dmyal ba rnams su gdungs nas las de nyid kyi lhag mas tshe rabs lnga brgyar yang dag pa
analyzed: des rang sangs rgyas la yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa btab pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas tshe rabs mang po dag tu sems can dmyal ba rnams su gdungs nas las de nyid kyi lhag mas tshe rabs lnga brgyar yang dag pa
translated: As a result of that karma, he was tormented in the hells for many lifetimes. The remainder of that karma caused him to slander the Pratyekabuddha with lies for five hundred lifetimes.

original: ma yin pas skur nas da ltar dgra bcom pa thob kyang yang dag pa ma yin pas skur to //🔽mchod pa byas nas smon lam btab pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ni nga'i drung du rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing 'dis rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas ches
analyzed: ma yin pas skur nas da ltar dgra bcom pa thob kyang yang dag pa ma yin pas skur to // mchod pa byas nas smon lam btab pa gang yin pa'i las de'i rnam par smin pas ni nga'i drung du rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing 'dis rang sangs rgyas bye ba phrag 'bum pas ches
translated: Now, although he attained arhatship, he slandered me with lies.

translated: Moreover, a monk

translated: “If he eats” means

translated: if he swallows it.🔽“Offense” means he will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama.🔽“Offense” means he will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama.

analyzed: zhag gnyis bshams dkrugs 'gro ba dang // rdeg dang gzas dang gnas ngan len //
translated: Striking, aiming at, and taking up a bad situation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ko'u shambhi na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Kauśāmbī in the Ghoṣira Grove.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod nas /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita knowingly used water containing living beings.

original: de la dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de la dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said to him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la ma spyod cig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la ma spyod cig /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, don’t knowingly use water containing living beings.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam ci /
analyzed: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam ci /
translated: “Did someone count them and give them to me?

original: shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por ci'i phyir mi 'gro /
analyzed: shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por ci'i phyir mi 'gro /
translated: Why don’t you go to the great ocean in the east?

original: lho dang nub dang byang gi rgya mtsho chen por ci'i phyir mi 'gro /
analyzed: lho dang nub dang byang gi rgya mtsho chen por ci'i phyir mi 'gro /
translated: Why don’t you go to the great oceans in the south, west, and north?

original: 'bab chu dang mtsho dang lteng ka dag tu ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag @242a *//
analyzed: 'bab chu dang mtsho dang lteng ka dag tu ci'i phyir mi 'gro zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag @242a *//
translated: Why don’t you go to the rivers, lakes, and ponds?”🔽“Why do monks knowingly use water that contains living beings?”

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod ces smod par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and complained and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, knowing the time, having thought about it, having reflected on it, having risen from his seat, and having gone to the assembly hall, sat down on the seat prepared for him.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks,🔽“Monks, you should not knowingly use water that contains living beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas, knowing, ask about the meaning of what was said.🔽

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa la rmas pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, knowing the situation, asked:

original: 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa bden nam /
analyzed: 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa bden nam /
translated: “Is it true, as they say, that you, Saṅgharakṣita, knowingly used water containing living organisms?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Bhadanta.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked him,🔽“Worthless man, this won’t arouse faith in those without faith.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: It’s not suitable, unworthy man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.🔽How could you knowingly use water containing living organisms?🔽Worthless man, this neither inspires faith in the faithless nor increases the faithful.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” After rebuking him in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks, having seen ten benefits, I establish a training rule for the monks, and so on as before.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon @242b par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon @242b par bya ste /
translated: “My disciples, you should recite this training rule:

original: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na ltung byed do //
translated: ‘If a monk knowingly uses water containing living beings, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: A monk: a monk who is so inclined, or another of the same kind.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
translated: Knowingly: he himself knows,

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: or others tell him.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Containing living beings: there are two kinds of living beings:

original: gang dag mig sngar snang bar gyur pa dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag mig sngar snang bar gyur pa dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: those that are visible to the eye, and those that are caught in a strainer.

original: chu la spyod na zhes bya ba ni chu'i spyad pa gnyis su ste nang gi dang phyi rol gyis so //
analyzed: chu la spyod na zhes bya ba ni chu'i spyad pa gnyis su ste nang gi dang phyi rol gyis so //
translated: “If he uses water” means that there are two ways of using water: internally and externally.

original: nang gir spyad pa ni khrus byed pa dang 'thung ba dang so shing 'dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang pa dag 'khru ba'o //
analyzed: nang gir spyad pa ni khrus byed pa dang 'thung ba dang so shing 'dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang pa dag 'khru ba'o //
translated: Using it internally means bathing, drinking, spitting out, and washing the hands and feet.

original: phyi rol gyir spyad pa ni lhung bzed 'khru ba dang / lhung bzed chung ngu 'khru ba dang / chos gos dag 'khru ba dang / tshon gyi las byed pa dang / gtsug lag khang du chag chag 'debs pa dang / zhal zhal skud pa dang /🔽lci ba sar pa'i byug pas nyug pa'o //🔽ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: phyi rol gyir spyad pa ni lhung bzed 'khru ba dang / lhung bzed chung ngu 'khru ba dang / chos gos dag 'khru ba dang / tshon gyi las byed pa dang / gtsug lag khang du chag chag 'debs pa dang / zhal zhal skud pa dang / lci ba sar pa'i byug pas nyug pa'o // ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: Using it externally means washing the begging-bowl, washing the small begging-bowl, washing the robes, dyeing, sprinkling the monastery, sweeping the monastery, and smearing it with cow-dung.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Offense” means that one will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the bad destinies, the lower realms, the unhappy migratory states, and the hells.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, as long as that downfall is not confessed and openly acknowledged, it obscures the virtuous dharmas. Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽dge slong gis srog chags @243a *//
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / dge slong gis srog chags @243a *//
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: dang bcas pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas spyod na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas spyod na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: A monk who uses water that contains living beings with the perception that it contains living beings commits a downfall.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas spyod na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas spyod na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pas spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: A monk who uses water that contains living beings with doubt as to whether it contains living beings commits a downfall.🔽A monk who uses water that does not contain living beings with the perception that it contains living beings commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags med pa'i chu la yid gnyis za bas spyod na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: A monk who uses water that does not contain living beings with doubt as to whether it contains living beings commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu pa dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i tshva dang 'bru'i tshva dang zhog chu dang rtsab mo 'thung na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu pa dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i tshva dang 'bru'i tshva dang zhog chu dang rtsab mo 'thung na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk eats clarified butter, oil, honey, molasses, milk, yogurt, or butter that contain living organisms, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If a monk drinks water, beer, or buttermilk that contain living organisms, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i shing tog dang bca' ba 'cha' na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i shing tog dang bca' ba 'cha' na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk eats fruit or vegetables that contain living organisms, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if he is the first offender; if he is overwhelmed by pain; or if he is the victim of an assault.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-first downfall.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char gas bsam pa'i nor bu'i rig pa shes te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char gas bsam pa'i nor bu'i rig pa shes te /
translated: The venerable Udayana knew the gem of thought.

original: de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: In the morning, he put on his under robe,

original: lhung bzed @243b dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: lhung bzed @243b dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: took his bowl and his robe, and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: mnyan yod na spos 'tshong gi khye'u chung ma blangs nas ring po ma lon pa zhig 'dug pa des zong bkram pa na bdag chung ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod du 'gro'o snyam pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa skyes nas des zong phyir
analyzed: mnyan yod na spos 'tshong gi khye'u chung ma blangs nas ring po ma lon pa zhig 'dug pa des zong bkram pa na bdag chung ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod du 'gro'o snyam pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa skyes nas des zong phyir
translated: In Śrāvastī, there lived a young incense merchant who had recently taken a wife. When he had laid out his wares, he thought, “I will go and enjoy myself with my wife.” He had an improper thought, and so he began to gather up his wares.

original: bsdu bar brtsams pa dang tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas de mthong nas bsams pa /
analyzed: bsdu bar brtsams pa dang tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas de mthong nas bsams pa /
translated: The venerable Udayana saw him and thought,🔽“

original: da ltar tshong pa gzhan dag zong 'grems par byed na spos 'tshong gi khye'u 'di zong sdud par byed pa ci'i phyir snyam nas des yang bsams pa dang / 'di chung ma blangs nas ring po ma lon pas 'di chung ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par 'dod do snyam du shes nas de dag song la re ba med par bya'o snyam nas de dang por de'i khyim du song ste stan la 'dug nas 'di skad🔽ces smras so //
analyzed: da ltar tshong pa gzhan dag zong 'grems par byed na spos 'tshong gi khye'u 'di zong sdud par byed pa ci'i phyir snyam nas des yang bsams pa dang / 'di chung ma blangs nas ring po ma lon pas 'di chung ma dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par 'dod do snyam du shes nas de dag song la re ba med par bya'o snyam nas de dang por de'i khyim du song ste stan la 'dug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The other merchants were putting out their wares, but this perfume merchant's son was putting his away. He thought, Why is that? He thought some more, and understood, It hasn't been long since he took a wife, so he wants to enjoy himself with her. He thought, I'll go and take away his hope. He went to his house first, sat on a seat, and said this:

original: bu mo tshur shog /
analyzed: bu mo tshur shog /
translated: Come here, girl!

original: 'dug cig dang chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug cig dang chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: Sit down and I will teach the Dharma.

original: bu mo des de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug pa dang des de la chos bstan par brtsams so //
analyzed: bu mo des de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug pa dang des de la chos bstan par brtsams so //
translated: The girl bowed at his feet and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma. He began to teach the Dharma to her.

original: ji tsam na spos 'tshong gi khye'u de 'ongs nas des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na spos 'tshong gi khye'u de 'ongs nas des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: Then the perfume merchant's son came and said to his wife,

original: 'phags pa 'char ka la bsod snyoms phul la bzhud du gsol cig /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'char ka la bsod snyoms phul la bzhud du gsol cig /
translated: Please give almsfood to the noble Udayi and ask him to leave.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
translated: Venerable Udayin said,

original: bzhin bzang kho bos bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i phyogs yongs su nyams par byas te 'ongs nas chos ston par byed na khyod chos nyan mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: bzhin bzang kho bos bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i phyogs yongs su nyams par byas te 'ongs nas chos ston par byed na khyod chos nyan mi 'dod dam /
translated: “Good man, I have come here having let my own virtuous side deteriorate. If I teach the Dharma, don’t you want to listen to the Dharma?

original: 'dug la chos nyon @244a *//
analyzed: 'dug la chos nyon @244a *//
translated: Sit down and listen to the Dharma.”🔽He forced him to sit down and taught him the Dharma to the point that he was freed from his entanglements.

original: cig ces des de nan kyis 'dug tu bcug ste des ji tsam gyis de'i kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba de tsam du chos bstan pa dang / de sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
analyzed: cig ces des de nan kyis 'dug tu bcug ste des ji tsam gyis de'i kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba de tsam du chos bstan pa dang / de sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go /
translated: He disparaged him, saying, “The religiousness of the Śākya’s disciples is a lie.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
translated: The brahmin’s religiousness is a lie.

original: 'di ltar rang gi chung ma la yang dbang med do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi chung ma la yang dbang med do zhes smod par byed /
translated: It is like this: He has no power over his own wife.”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: He ridiculed him.

original: kha zer bar byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim du phyis gnon byas te stan la 'dug par byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim du phyis gnon byas te stan la 'dug par byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized him, spread it about, saying, “How can monks knowingly sit on a seat in a house where a couple is lying down together?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having given an exhortation on this matter, addressed the monks, saying, “Monks, I rescind the permission to sit on a seat in a house where a couple is lying down together.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are teachers who know and see.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha asked the venerable Udayin:

original: 'char ka khyod shes bzhin du nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim du phyis gnon byas te stan la 'dug pa bden nam /
analyzed: 'char ka khyod shes bzhin du nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim du phyis gnon byas te stan la 'dug pa bden nam /
translated: “Ākāśa, is it true that you did this?”

original: btsun pa mad do //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: btsun pa mad do // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Reverend.”

original: rung ba ma @244b yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma @244b yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked him, “Ākāśa, this is not fitting for a renunciant, it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy of a renunciant, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.🔽How could you do such a thing?

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //

analyzed: seng ge ltar mche ba can gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar ngang pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar ngang pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: nam mkha' lding ltar bya'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: bram ze ltar slob ma'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa ltar nad pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / dpa' bo ltar ru ba'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: sa mkhan ltar lam du zhugs pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / ded dpon ltar tshong pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / tshong dpon ltar 'khor gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a group of travelers, like a guide.🔽He was surrounded by a group of merchants, like a caravan leader.🔽He was surrounded by a group of attendants, like a guild master.

analyzed: @250b mkhar gyi rgyal po ltar blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ltar bu stong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

original: zla ba ltar rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: zla ba ltar rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

analyzed: 'phags skyes po ltar grul bum gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / mig mi bzang ltar klu'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / nor sbyin ltar gnod sbyin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of kumbhāṇḍas, like Virūpākṣa.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of nāgas, like Virūḍhaka.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of yakṣas, like Kubera.

original: thags bzang ris ltar lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽brgya byin ltar sum cu pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: thags bzang ris ltar lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / brgya byin ltar sum cu pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /

original: tshangs pa ltar tshangs pa ris kyis tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: tshangs pa ltar tshangs pa ris kyis tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of the class of Brahmā, like Brahmā.

original: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu dul ba spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu dul ba spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa /
translated: He was very disciplined in his senses, and his behavior and conduct were undisturbed.

original: chu gter ltar ting nge ba /
analyzed: chu gter ltar ting nge ba /
translated: He was as still as an ocean.

original: sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa /

original: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dang bral ba /
translated: He was free of arrogance like the king of elephants.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He was well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: His body was beautiful with the eighty minor marks.

original: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
translated: He was adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: and his radiance was greater than a thousand suns.

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
translated: He was as beautiful as a mountain of jewels.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He possessed the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the three unique recollections, and great compassion.

original: kun shes @251a *//
analyzed: kun shes @251a *//
translated: He was all-knowing.

original: ko'u di n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / grags pa dang / gang bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bza' la sogs pa nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
analyzed: ko'u di n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / grags pa dang / gang bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bza' la sogs pa nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
translated: Kauṇḍinya, Aśvajit, Bhadrika, Vāṣpa, Mahānāman, Yaśas, Revata, Śuddhipanthaka, Gopaka, Ghaṭikāra, and so forth,

original: gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun rab tu mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te mnyan yod ga la der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun rab tu mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te mnyan yod ga la der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
translated: and a great saṅgha of many monks.

original: don mthun de dang shes pa can zhig lhan cig 'gro ba de phongs pa'i dus la bab cing bkres pas nyam thag par gyur nas /
analyzed: don mthun de dang shes pa can zhig lhan cig 'gro ba de phongs pa'i dus la bab cing bkres pas nyam thag par gyur nas /
translated: A certain wise man was traveling with that caravan. When the time came for him to be in need, he was afflicted by hunger.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: bdag gang gis bkres pas nyam thag par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yod snyam nas des yang bsams pa /
analyzed: bdag gang gis bkres pas nyam thag par mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ci yod snyam nas des yang bsams pa /
translated: “What can I do so that I will not be afflicted by hunger?” He thought further,🔽“

original: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams la skyabs btsal na des bdag bde bar lam du 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas de dge slong rnams kyi gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams la skyabs btsal na des bdag bde bar lam du 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas de dge slong rnams kyi gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: Knowing this, he went to the monks and said,

original: khyed cag gi ston pa ni bzang po la mos pa yin te /
analyzed: khyed cag gi ston pa ni bzang po la mos pa yin te /
translated: “Your teacher is devoted to good things.

original: de gser gyi gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des khyed cag la zas ro brgya pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba dang khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang rjes su gnang bas khyed cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang bde ba la reg par gnas la /
analyzed: de gser gyi gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des khyed cag la zas ro brgya pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba dang khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang rjes su gnang bas khyed cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang bde ba la reg par gnas la /
translated: Since he plows the fields with a golden plow, he allows you to eat food of a hundred flavors, wear clothes worth a hundred thousand, and live in five hundred-storied mansions. You will remain in the happiness of this very life.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even after you die and transmigrate, you will be reborn among the gods.

original: kho bo cag gi ston pa ni ngan pa la mos pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ston pa ni ngan pa la mos pa yin te /
translated: Our teacher is devoted to bad things.

original: de til gyi tshigs ma'i gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des kho bo cag la gcer bu dang sgre byi dang / sbrang zan @251b dang / yul rgyu ba dang / sa la nyal ba las gzhan rjes su ma gnang bas kho bo cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang sdug bsngal la reg par gnas shing /
analyzed: de til gyi tshigs ma'i gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des kho bo cag la gcer bu dang sgre byi dang / sbrang zan @251b dang / yul rgyu ba dang / sa la nyal ba las gzhan rjes su ma gnang bas kho bo cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang sdug bsngal la reg par gnas shing /
translated: He plowed the fields with a plow made of sesame seeds. He did not allow us to do anything other than go naked, beg for food, eat from our cupped hands, wander the countryside, and sleep on the ground. We are now suffering in this life,

original: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang sems can dmyal ba pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and after we die we will be reborn among the hell beings.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The monks thought,

original: shes pa can 'di dad par gyur to snyam nas de dag gis de la smras pa /
analyzed: shes pa can 'di dad par gyur to snyam nas de dag gis de la smras pa /
translated: “This wise man has become faithful.” They said to him,

original: shes pa can ji ltar 'tshor dka' bas so //
analyzed: shes pa can ji ltar 'tshor dka' bas so //
translated: “Wise man, it is because it is difficult to live.”

original: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma 'dod dam /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you want the leftovers from the monks’ alms bowls?”

original: shes pa can des bsams pa /
analyzed: shes pa can des bsams pa /
translated: The wise man thought,

analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma ma zos na ltogs te 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas des smras pa /
translated: “If I do not eat the leftovers from the monks’ alms bowls, I will die of hunger.” He said,🔽“Yes, I want them.”

original: 'tshal lo // dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'tshal lo // dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

analyzed: shes pa can dge slong rnams zan za ba'i mig lam du 'dug cig dang / dge slong rnams khyod la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma sbyin par 'gyur ro //

translated: The learned one sat in the presence of the monks while they ate, and the monks gave him the leftovers from their bowls. He filled his carrying pouch with the leftovers.

analyzed: de slong phor 'khur bas byur bur byas pa thogs te phyir byung ba ded dpon gyis mthong nas des smras pa /

original: shes pa can khyod la 'khur ba sus byin /
analyzed: shes pa can khyod la 'khur ba sus byin /
translated: “Learned one, who gave you this?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The man said, I am not a thief.

original: khyed kyi yon gnas ni dge slong de dag yin la de dag gi yon gnas ni kho bo yin pas kho bo la de dag gis phul lo //
analyzed: khyed kyi yon gnas ni dge slong de dag yin la de dag gi yon gnas ni kho bo yin pas kho bo la de dag gis phul lo //
translated: Since those monks are your benefactors and you are my benefactor, they gave it to me.”

original: ded dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: ded dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The caravan leader said,

original: shes pa can dge @252a *//
analyzed: shes pa can dge @252a *//
translated: “Learned one,

analyzed: slong rnams kyis khyod la snying rje bas byin na khyod de skad ces de dag gis yon gnas kho bo yin zhes zer ram /
translated: The beggars said, You are giving out of compassion for us, but you say, 'They are giving to me, the worthy recipient.'

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan par gyur na /
translated: If the Blessed One hears about this,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i gnas yod do //
translated: he will establish a rule for the disciples, saying, 'This is how you should act in such a situation.'

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

analyzed: ded dpon mad kyang bzhad gad bgyis so //
translated: Merchant, you are right, but I am laughing.

original: lam de nas don mthun tshur 'ong ba dag cig lhags nas don mthun de dang lhan cig shes pa can zhig 'ongs pa des de mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: lam de nas don mthun tshur 'ong ba dag cig lhags nas don mthun de dang lhan cig shes pa can zhig 'ongs pa des de mthong nas smras pa /

original: shes pa can nyod pa nyod dam des smras pa /
analyzed: shes pa can nyod pa nyod dam des smras pa /
translated: The wise man said, He has passed by.

original: nyod do // gang nas /
analyzed: nyod do // gang nas /

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The wise man said,

analyzed: khyim bdag sgre byi 'di dag kho bo la mkho bo stobs par byed do //
translated: These merchants of mine are giving me what I need.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The other said,

original: shes pa can khyod ni byis pa mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa can khyod ni byis pa mi shes pa yin te /
translated: Wise man, you are a fool.

analyzed: 'di dag khyod kyi khyim bdag sgre byi dag yin nam /

translated: He spoke these verses:

analyzed: ngan pa ci phyir sa la 'bying mi byed //
translated: “Why don’t you fall to the ground in despair?

analyzed: ci phyir lce yang tshal ba brgyar mi 'gas // khyod kyi lus la ci phyir gsar ba dag /
translated: Why doesn’t your tongue split into a hundred pieces?🔽Why doesn’t a vajra rain down on your body?

original: rdo rje'i ser ba mdung thung mda' mi 'phen //🔽ji ltar seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ser ba mdung thung mda' mi 'phen // ji ltar seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa //
translated: Why don’t you shoot arrows and spears?🔽“Just as a jackal who eats the remains of a lion

original: seng ge nyid la gsod pa 'dod pa ltar //
analyzed: seng ge nyid la gsod pa 'dod pa ltar //
translated: wants to kill the lion itself,

original: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs @252b bcu'i khyos za zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs @252b bcu'i khyos za zhing //
translated: so you, who eat the leftovers of the one with ten powers,

original: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
analyzed: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
translated: are not noble, but slander the one with ten powers.

original: gang du gang la nye bar brten byas nas //
analyzed: gang du gang la nye bar brten byas nas //
translated: “In whatever place you live,

original: mi ngan 'di 'dras 'tsho ba 'thob pa las //
analyzed: mi ngan 'di 'dras 'tsho ba 'thob pa las //
translated: you will be a bad person who gets his living

analyzed: de ni nges par mdza' bshes dgra rnams la; ;mnyam mdzad blo ldan thams cad mkhyen pa yin //
translated: He is the Omniscient One, the Wise One, who treats friends and enemies equally.

original: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
analyzed: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
translated: Those who do not know how to repay kindness

original: de dag khyi bas shin tu ngan par bsam //
analyzed: de dag khyi bas shin tu ngan par bsam //
translated: are to be considered even worse than dogs.

original: khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
analyzed: khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
translated: Dogs are seen to know how to repay kindness,

original: sbrul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed //
analyzed: sbrul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed //

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, for the time being, did not establish a training precept for the disciples regarding the Vinaya.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na /
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering among the Kośalas,

original: mnyan yod du byon to //
analyzed: mnyan yod du byon to //

translated: In a park in Śrāvastī, about five hundred widows were spinning wool. They saw the Blessed Buddha, who was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: gzugs can lta bu chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzugs can lta bu chos dang ldan pa /
translated: He is like a physical form, endowed with the Dharma.

original: bsreg byas btab ba'i me lta bu /
analyzed: bsreg byas btab ba'i me lta bu /
translated: He is like a fire that burns what is to be burned.

original: gser gyi snod na 'dug pa'i mar me lta bu /
analyzed: gser gyi snod na 'dug pa'i mar me lta bu /
translated: He is like a lamp in a golden vessel.

original: gser gyi ri bo 'gro ba lta bu /
analyzed: gser gyi ri bo 'gro ba lta bu /
