translated: They went to one side and sat down, their minds troubled.

original: ji tsam na ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: In the meantime, King Prasenajit of Kosala arrived and asked,

original: khyed cag ci'i phyir mi 'dong bar mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: khyed cag ci'i phyir mi 'dong bar mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Why are you not going? Why have you gone to one side and are sitting there, your minds troubled?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: “Deva, how can we be victorious?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
translated: “These shaven-headed śramaṇas are everywhere, and they are always coming to me for cotton cloth.”

original: gang dag / 'phags @258b pa drug sde dag go /
analyzed: gang dag / 'phags @258b pa drug sde dag go /
translated: “Noble ones, they are the group of six.”

original: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pas khyed la ci gnod deng zhig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pas khyed la ci gnod deng zhig /
translated: “Sirs, they are shaven-headed śramaṇas who are frauds. What harm can they do by talking? Go away.”

original: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala thought,🔽“They will keep on harassing me again and again.”

original: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la mtho 'tsham par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la mtho 'tsham par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
translated: Knowing this,

original: mi zhig la smras pa /
analyzed: mi zhig la smras pa /
translated: he said to a man,

original: kva'e nang rje tshur shog /
analyzed: kva'e nang rje tshur shog /
translated: “Hey, come here.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Go to the Blessed One and, on my behalf, bow down with your head to his feet.

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba chung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam / nyam nga ba chung ngam /
translated: Ask him, ‘Blessed One, do you have few troubles,🔽few worries,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: light activities,🔽and good health?

original: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
translated: Are you strong and living in comfort?’

original: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol la /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol la /
translated: “Are you free from distress?”

original: 'di skad ces ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
analyzed: 'di skad ces ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
translated: “Noble ones, King Prasenajit of Kosala says this: ‘Venerable ones, it seems you are preparing for war.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa ltar 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol cig /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa ltar 'chi bar mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol cig /
translated: Oh, if the Blessed One would have some compassion and make some provisions so that the noble ones will not die while preparing for war.’

original: mi des lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: mi des lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: “‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ that man replied, and he went to see the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: When he arrived, he bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then he sat down to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas mi des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas mi des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat down to one side, that man said to the Blessed One,🔽“‘

original: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal bcom ldan 'das @259a *//
analyzed: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal bcom ldan 'das @259a *//
translated: The venerable King Prasenajit of Kosala bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One

original: kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: and asked the Blessed One about his health:

original: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /
translated: “Are you having few troubles, Blessed One?

original: nyam nga ba chung ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba chung ngam /
translated: Are you having few illnesses?

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: Are you light in your activities?

original: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
translated: Are you well? Are you strong? Are you living comfortably?

original: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol lo //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol lo //
translated: Are you without any problems?”

original: kva'i nang rje ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
analyzed: kva'i nang rje ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
translated: “O King, may you be well, together with the King of Kosala.

original: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
analyzed: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
translated: The venerable King Prasenajit of Kosala says this:

original: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
translated: ‘Venerable, these noble ones are going to see the army’s preparations.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi ba mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba chung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so //
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi ba mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba chung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so //
translated: Oh, if the Blessed One would be so kind as to make a rule that would prevent the noble ones from going to see the army’s preparations.’”

original: zhes mchi'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: zhes mchi'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the man by his silence.

original: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then the man, understanding that by his silence the Blessed One had assented, bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and then departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this incident, because of this cause, because of this situation, assembled the community of monks and said to the monks,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: “Monks, it has been said by me that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, know, and that they know and see as it really is.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /🔽dge slong dag khyed dmag chas @259b pa la ltar 'gro ba bden nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa / dge slong dag khyed dmag chas @259b pa la ltar 'gro ba bden nam /
translated: The Blessed Buddha asked the group-of-six monks,

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Monks, is it true that you went to see an army arrayed in battle formation?”🔽“Yes, it’s true, O Blessed One.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not a concession,🔽it is not in accord with the Dharma,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accord with the monastic code,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: and it is not proper for a renunciant.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having criticized him in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks, I establish a training rule for the monks, seeing ten benefits: for the comfort of the monks, for the stilling of disputes, for the stilling of criticism, for the stilling of legal issues, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions not yet arisen, for the removal of corruptions already arisen, for the growth of the pure community, and for the support of the true Dharma.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyi 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyi 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Monks, this training rule for the monks should be proclaimed like this:

original: yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro na ltung byed do //
translated: ‘If a monk goes to see an army arrayed for battle, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Monks” means the group of six or anyone similar to them.

original: dmag ces bya ba la dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod /
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba la dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod /
translated: “Army” means there is an army with one branch,

original: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
translated: there is an army with two branches,

original: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
translated: there is an army with three branches,

original: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
translated: and there is an army with four branches.

original: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with one branch?

original: glang po che'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army of elephants.

original: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with two branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army of elephants and an army of horses.

original: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with three branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army of elephants, an army of horses, and an army of chariots.

original: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with four branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
translated: It is an army of elephants, an army of horses, an army of chariots, and an army of infantry.

original: chas pa la zhes bya ba ni /🔽@260a *// g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: chas pa la zhes bya ba ni /🔽@260a *// g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la'o //
translated: “Setting out” means🔽to go to battle.

original: ltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni 'gro na'o //🔽ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni 'gro na'o // ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “If he goes” means if he goes.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Offense” means that he will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama, into bad rebirths, bad destinies, and downfalls.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and does not go away, it is an obscuration to wholesome dharmas.” Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: dge slong ji tsam cung zad dmag chas pa ltar 'gro na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ji tsam cung zad dmag chas pa ltar 'gro na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: “If a bhikṣu goes to the army in any way, he commits an offense.”

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dmag 'gro ba dang gtsug lag khang lam ka na 'dug pa dang / dmag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs pa dang / rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dmag 'gro ba dang gtsug lag khang lam ka na 'dug pa dang / dmag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs pa dang / rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: When a monk is begging for alms, there is no offense if he sees an army on the road, or if the monastery is on the road, or if the army comes to the monastery, or if he is summoned by the king, the queen, the prince, the minister, the general, the city folk, or the country folk.

original: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if any of the eight impediments is present.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or for someone whose mind is deranged or overwhelmed by pain, or for someone who is insane or deranged.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-fifth downfall is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: ri brags pa de de ltar na yang ma phebs nas rgyal pos de nyid du phru ma btab ste 'dug pa dang / @260b blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ri brags pa de de ltar na yang ma phebs nas rgyal pos de nyid du phru ma btab ste 'dug pa dang / @260b blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The king said, I will stay right here and dig a well.

original: lha khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin ni bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa can dbang che bar grags pa lags pas /
analyzed: lha khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin ni bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa can dbang che bar grags pa lags pas /
translated: The ministers said, Your Majesty, the householder Anāthapiṇḍada is known to be very powerful because of the ripening of his merit.

original: gal te de mchis par gyur na de'i mthus ri brags pa 'di phebs par 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ba gda'o //
analyzed: gal te de mchis par gyur na de'i mthus ri brags pa 'di phebs par 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ba gda'o //
translated: If he were to come here, it is possible that the mountain would move by his power.

original: rgyal pos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag mthong bar 'dod do zhes yi ge spring pa dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin der 'ongs so //
analyzed: rgyal pos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag mthong bar 'dod do zhes yi ge spring pa dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin der 'ongs so //
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala sent a letter to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, saying, “Householder, I wish to see you.” The householder Anāthapiṇḍada came there.

original: de lta na yang ri brags pa de ma phebs nas ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa; khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
analyzed: de lta na yang ri brags pa de ma phebs nas ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa; khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
translated: Even then, the mountain did not move. King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, Householder, do you not remember the children?

original: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: The gods did not remember the children, so they said, “Noble ones, we wish to see them.”

original: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala sent a letter to the saṅgha, saying, “Noble ones, I wish to see them.”

original: zhes yi ge spring pa dang dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge bklags te gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long zhig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: zhes yi ge spring pa dang dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge bklags te gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long zhig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
translated: The monk in charge of announcements read the letter in the middle of the saṅgha and said, “Whoever is willing to go there should take a voting stick.”

original: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas der 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas der 'gro mi nus so //
translated: The senior monks said, “We are old and infirm, so we are unable to go there.”

original: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
translated: The junior monks said,

original: der chos bstan par bya dgos na bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos ston par ni mi nus na der chu brim par bya'am ci /
analyzed: der chos bstan par bya dgos na bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos ston par ni mi nus na der chu brim par bya'am ci /
translated: “We must teach the Dharma there, but we have studied little, so we are unable to teach the Dharma. So should we just go there to distribute water?

original: bdag cag kyang der 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang der 'gro mi nus so //
translated: We are also unable to go there.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' @261a *// bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste ji srid du bdag cag
analyzed: dga' @261a *// bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste ji srid du bdag cag
translated: “As long as the Blessed One lives and we are alive, the teaching will remain. But when the Blessed One has passed into parinirvāṇa and we have died, the teaching will disappear. As long as we are alive, we will cherish the teaching.”

original: gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dong nas /
analyzed: gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dong nas /
translated: They took the voting sticks and went there.

original: rgyal po la chos bstan pas rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po la chos bstan pas rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: They taught the Dharma to the king, and the king became a faithful lay disciple.

original: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dag dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dag dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: They taught the Dharma to the queen, the princes, the ministers, and the leaders of the merchants, and a great many people became faithful lay disciples.

original: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala said to his ministers,🔽“Gentlemen, the Blessed One has passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: ri brags pa bskor du 'dong ngo zhes de dag 'phags pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ri brags pa bskor du 'dong ngo zhes de dag 'phags pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: Let's go on a tour of the mountain. They set out, and the group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya /
translated: Nandaka, Upanandaka, how long are we going to live by the conduct of others?

original: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
analyzed: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
translated: We should live by our own conduct.

original: gsus po che'i dmag ci 'dra ba ltar 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam gar dong ste 'khod pa dang / ji tsam na glang po che'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gsus po che'i dmag ci 'dra ba ltar 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam gar dong ste 'khod pa dang / ji tsam na glang po che'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Let's go like a great army of pot-bellied ones. They went to the road and sat down. When the elephant herd came, they said,

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
translated: Noble ones, make way! Make way!

original: ci bya / glang po che'i tshogs mchi'o //
analyzed: ci bya / glang po che'i tshogs mchi'o //
translated: What's the matter? The elephant herd is coming.

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam /
translated: You wretched ones, are these elephants like this?

original: phag dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mche ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
analyzed: phag dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mche ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
translated: They're like pigs. They grabbed the tusks and threw them to one side.

original: @261b ji tsam na rta pa'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: @261b ji tsam na rta pa'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: When the cavalry came, they said,

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
translated: Noble ones, make way! Make way!

original: ci bya / rta pa'i tshogs mchi'o //
analyzed: ci bya / rta pa'i tshogs mchi'o //
translated: What is to be done? The cavalry is coming!”

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra pa dag rta yin nam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra pa dag rta yin nam /
translated: “You miserable men, are these horses?”

original: bong bu dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //🔽ji tsam na shing rta pa'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bong bu dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro // ji tsam na shing rta pa'i tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “They are like donkeys!” They grabbed their tails and threw them to one side.

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
translated: Then the caravan of chariots arrived. They said, “Noble ones, make way! Make way!”

original: ci bya / shing rta pa'i tshogs mchi'o //
analyzed: ci bya / shing rta pa'i tshogs mchi'o //
translated: “What is to be done? The caravan of chariots is coming!”

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam /
translated: “You miserable men, are these chariots?”

original: shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //🔽ji tsam na dpung bu chung gi tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro // ji tsam na dpung bu chung gi tshogs 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “They are like broken chariots!” They grabbed their axles and threw them to one side.

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig /
translated: Then the caravan of infantry arrived. They said, “Noble ones, make way! Make way!”

original: ci bya / dbung bu chung gi tshogs mchi'o //
analyzed: ci bya / dbung bu chung gi tshogs mchi'o //
translated: “What is to be done? The caravan of infantry is coming!”

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag mi yin nam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag mi yin nam /
translated: “You miserable men, are these men?”

original: rtsva mi dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor nas de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: rtsva mi dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor nas de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
translated: “They are just like grass and sticks,” and they grabbed them by the neck and threw them outside. They sat there, their minds filled with grief.

original: ji tsam na ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala came.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He asked,

original: shes ldan dag ci'i phyir khyed cag mi 'dong bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ci'i phyir khyed cag mi 'dong bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Sirs, why are you sitting here, your minds filled with grief, and not going?”

original: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: “Your Majesty, how could we be victorious?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
translated: These shaven-headed religious impostors, who wear the mendicants’ outer robe, come and go as they please.”

original: gang dag / 'phags pa drug sde dag go /
analyzed: gang dag / 'phags pa drug sde dag go /
translated: “Noble ones, they are the group of six.

original: shes ldan dag 'di dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de @262a *//
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'di dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de @262a *//
translated: “Sirs, they are shaven-headed religious impostors.

original: dag gis smras pas khyed la ci gnod /
analyzed: dag gis smras pas khyed la ci gnod /
translated: What harm have they done to you?🔽“Let them go.”

original: deng zhig / ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: deng zhig / ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala thought,

original: 'di dag bdag la yang dang yang du mtho 'tsham par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag bdag la yang dang yang du mtho 'tsham par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
translated: Knowing this,

original: mi zhig la smras pa /
analyzed: mi zhig la smras pa /
translated: he said to a man,

original: kva'e nang rje tshur shog /
analyzed: kva'e nang rje tshur shog /
translated: “Hey, you there, come here!🔽Go to the Blessed One and, in my name, bow your head to the Blessed One’s feet.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song la nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba chung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song la nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam / nyam nga ba chung ngam /
translated: Then ask him, ‘Blessed One, do you have few troubles,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: are you enduring, are you strong,

original: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /
translated: are you living comfortably, and are you healthy?’

original: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol la 'di skad ces btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam zhes snyun gsol la 'di skad ces btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
translated: And say this: ‘Lord, King Prasenajit of Kosala says

original: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
translated: that since these noble ones have gone out to see the army, they will remain in the army for a very long time.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring po dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring po dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig
translated: “Oh, out of compassion, may the Blessed One please do something so that the noble ones will not have to go to war and will not have to stay in the army for a long time.”

original: bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol cig /
analyzed: bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol cig /
translated: “Please ask the Blessed One to do something so that the noble ones will remember to do something.”

original: mi des lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las mnyan nas /
analyzed: mi des lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las mnyan nas /
translated: “As you wish, Deva,” the man replied to King Prasenajit of Kosala.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the Blessed One and, on arrival,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug @262b go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug @262b go /
translated: bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas mi des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas mi des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: As he was sitting there, the man said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: “Blessed One, King Prasenajit of Kosala bows his head at the Blessed One’s feet🔽and says this:

original: bcom ldan 'das la nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: “Are you free from distress,

original: gnod pa chung ngam /🔽bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: gnod pa chung ngam / bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: free from sickness,🔽in good health,

original: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam /🔽kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / stobs dang bde ba la reg par gnas sam / kha na ma tho ba ma mchis sam /
translated: and strong?

original: zhes snyun gsol la /
analyzed: zhes snyun gsol la /
translated: Are you without offense?”

original: kva'e nang rje ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
analyzed: kva'e nang rje ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
translated: “O householder, may King Prasenajit of Kosala and you be well.

original: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
analyzed: btsun pa ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi mchid nas /
translated: “O Venerable One, King Prasenajit of Kosala says:

original: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas /
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas /
translated: ‘O Venerable Ones, as you are going to see the army arrayed,

original: shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
translated: if you stay in the midst of the army for a long time,

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas /
translated: then, O Blessed One, out of compassion, please allow the Noble Ones to see the army arrayed,🔽and

original: shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o //
analyzed: shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o //
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would give the noble ones some small instruction to remember, so that we will not have to stay in the army for a very long time.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to that man by his silence.🔽Then, knowing that by his silence the Blessed One had assented,

original: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
translated: that man rose from his seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and after bowing down to the Blessed One, circumambulating him three times, he left.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen du rmed par mdzad @263a *//🔽pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen du rmed par mdzad @263a *// pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this incident, because of this cause, because of this situation, gathered the saṅgha of monks and said to them, “Monks, from now on, you should not go to the army for more than three nights.🔽The Buddha, the Blessed One, knowing that this was so,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag la rmas pa /
translated: asked the group of six monks,🔽“Monks, is it true that you did this?”

original: dge slong dag khyed dmag chas pa la ltar song nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa bden nam /🔽btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed dmag chas pa la ltar song nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa bden nam / btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, Reverend.”🔽The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: “Foolish men, this is not fitting for ascetics, it is not fit, it is not proper, it is not worthy of ascetics, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: How can you go to see an army, and then stay among them for a very long time?🔽Foolish men, it is not suitable for you to do this.🔽Foolish men, have I not given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion; for freedom from bondage, not for the sake of bondage; for the sake of non-grasping, not for the sake of grasping?🔽Foolish men, this will not tend to inspire those without confidence, and will cause some with confidence to change their minds.”🔽After rebuking those monks in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /🔽dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa / dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the Teacher said to the monks,🔽“Monks, I establish a training rule for my disciples, having seen ten benefits: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions not yet arisen, for the removal of corruptions already arisen, for the comfort of those who are pure, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the growth of the true Dharma, and for the lasting existence of the true teaching.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Therefore the monks should recite this training rule:🔽‘“I will not go to see an army,” this is how you should train.’

original: dge slong dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
analyzed: dge slong dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
translated: If a condition like that of a monk who goes to see an army in its camp arises,

original: dge slong des dmag de'i nang du zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des dmag de'i nang du zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //
translated: that monk may stay within that army for two nights at most.

original: de las lhag par gnas na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par gnas na ltung byed do //
translated: If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “A monk” refers to the group of six or anyone similar to them.

original: dmag ces bya ba la dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod /
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba la dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod /
translated: “Army” means an army with one branch,

original: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
translated: an army with two branches,

original: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
translated: an army with three branches,

original: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
translated: and an army with four branches.

original: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with one branch?

original: glang po che yi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che yi tshogs so //
translated: It is a group of elephants.

original: dmag yan lag gnyis pa @263b gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gnyis pa @263b gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with two branches?

original: glang po che pa'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che pa'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is a group of elephants and a group of horses.

original: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with three branches?

original: glang po che pa'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che pa'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is a group of elephants, a group of horses, and a group of chariots.

original: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with four branches?

analyzed: glang po che ba'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //

analyzed: chas pa la zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la la'o //

analyzed: ltar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis so //

analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //

analyzed: dmag de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni dmag chas pa de'i nang du'o // zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //

analyzed: de las lhag par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par gnas na'o //

translated: “Offense” means that one will be cooked, burned, and fallen into the hells, animal realm, and the world of hungry ghosts—into bad rebirths, bad destinies, downfalls.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “And more than that” means more than that.🔽“Offense” means that one will be cooked, burned, and fallen into the hells, animal realm, and the world of hungry ghosts—into bad rebirths, bad destinies, downfalls.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and disclosed,

analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: it is an obscuration to wholesome dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam na cung zad zhag gnyis las lhag par dmag @264a *//

analyzed: gi nang na gnas na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: in every case he comes to offend.🔽The king, the queen, the prince, the ministers, the leaders of the guilds, the town-dwellers, and the country-dwellers say,

analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mi na re /
translated: The king, the queen, the prince, the ministers, the leaders of the merchants, the people of the city, and the people of the countryside said:🔽

analyzed: 'dug cig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he says, “Sit down.”

analyzed: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na ltung ba med do //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //

analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu drug pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-sixth downfall is finished.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so // ri brags pa de de lta na yang ma phebs nas ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī.

original: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
analyzed: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
translated: The king of Kāśi, Prasenajit, said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, “Householder, do you not remember the boys?”

analyzed: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: “Your Majesty, I do not remember the boys, but I would like to see the noble ones.”

analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring pa dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge bklags te gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long zhig ces tshul shing brims pa dang /

original: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas der 'gro bar mi nus so //

original: dge slong gsar bu gsar @264b bu dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu gsar @264b bu dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: der chos bstan par bya dgos na bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos ston par mi nus na der chu brims par bya'am /

analyzed: ci bdag cag kyang der 'gro mi nus so //

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“We are not able to go there either.”

analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /

translated: They took the voting sticks and went there. By teaching the Dharma to the king, they caused him to develop faith.

analyzed: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dag dang / zhang lon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: They also taught the Dharma to the queen, the princes, the ministers, and the leaders of the merchants, and they caused a great crowd of people to develop faith.

analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /

analyzed: deng la g-yul shoms shig dang ri brags pa bskor bar bya'o //

analyzed: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /

analyzed: gsus po che'i rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog dang / g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byas 'dong ngo zhes de dag glang po che'i tshogs kyi @265a *//
translated: They went to the elephant troops

analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: 'phags pa dag bkod pa shom mo //

analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

analyzed: dge sbyong gang dag / 'phags pa drug sde dag go /
translated: “What ascetics?”🔽“The noble group of six.”

analyzed: shes ldan dag @266a *//
translated: “Sirs,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song la nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Bow your head at the Blessed One’s two feet and say to him,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /
translated: “Are you free from trouble,

analyzed: nyam nga ba chung ngam / bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: free from distress,🔽in good health,
