translated: The same applies to the downfalls of experiencing the best of victory banners, the best of armies, and the formation of an army.

original: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if any of the eight obstructions is present.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrug pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrug pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bdun pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bdun pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-seventh downfall is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Jetavana, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park, in Śrāvastī.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung /
translated: When the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana gave the going forth🔽and the full ordination to the group of seventeen young men, the new group of students headed by Upāli,

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na de dag drug sde dag la sten par byed /🔽bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na de dag drug sde dag la sten par byed / bsnyen par byed /
translated: they attended on the group of six,

original: bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: served them, and venerated them.

original: de nas 'char kas smras pa /🔽bcu bdun sde @269a *//
analyzed: de nas 'char kas smras pa / bcu bdun sde @269a *//
translated: Then Udayin said,

original: dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come here, group of seventeen!

original: 'di dang 'di gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di gyis shig /
translated: Do this and that!”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: ci khyod kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
analyzed: ci khyod kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
translated: “Are you our preceptor or teacher?

original: mi byed do //
analyzed: mi byed do //
translated: We will not do it.”

original: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig brdegs pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag brdegs so //
analyzed: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig brdegs pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag brdegs so //
translated: He said, “You fools, what else will you do?” He struck one of them, and all of them said, “He struck us!

original: bdag cag brdegs so zhes phyis gan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so //
analyzed: bdag cag brdegs so zhes phyis gan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so //
translated: He struck us!” and they fell down on their backs and began to cry.🔽The monks said,

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: “Venerable ones,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la rdeg par byed /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la rdeg par byed /
translated: “Venerable Udayī, why are you beating the young men?”

original: 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: 'char kas smras pa /
translated: Udayī said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig brdegs pa dang thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu'o;/
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig brdegs pa dang thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu'o;/
translated: “Venerables, when I beat one of them, they all fall to the ground and cry.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to the group of seventeen,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag las gcig brdegs na ci phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag las gcig brdegs na ci phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu /
translated: “Venerables, when one of you is beaten, why do they all fall to the ground and cry?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: gal te ma ngus na thams cad brdeg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma ngus na thams cad brdeg par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If we don’t cry, they’ll beat us all.”🔽“Why do monks who are angry, displeased, and furious beat monks?”

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg par byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg par byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, on this occasion, for this reason, and with this pretext, assembled the saṅgha of monks.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang @269b snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang @269b snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, know the right time, the right season, for listening to the recitation of the scriptures.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha asked the venerable Udayin:

original: 'char ka khyod khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong rnams la rdeg pa bden nam /🔽btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: 'char ka khyod khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong rnams la rdeg pa bden nam / btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Udayin, is it true that you, angry, displeased, and upset, beat the monks?”🔽“Yes, it’s true, Venerable.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha rebuked him,

original: rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no //
translated: “It’s not suitable, Udayin, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a renunciant, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

original: zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: Renunciants should not do that.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having censured him in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks, I make known to the monks a basis for training:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: ‘My disciples should train in this way:

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam bar gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg na ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam bar gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg na ltung byed do //
translated: “If a monk, out of anger, should strike a monk, he should be dealt with according to the rule.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‘If a monk’ means if Śāriputra or if any other monk.

original: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
analyzed: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
translated: ‘Out of anger, should strike a monk’ means if, out of anger, he should strike a monk.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: ‘A monk’ means one who belongs to this Dharma.

original: rdeg na zhes bya ba ni rdeg par byed na'o //
analyzed: rdeg na zhes bya ba ni rdeg par byed na'o //
translated: “If he strikes” means if he hits.

original: ltung byed do //
analyzed: ltung byed do //
translated: He commits an offense entailing confession.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: “He will burn, he will boil, he will fall” means he will burn, boil, and fall into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of hungry ghosts—into lower realms, bad places, and inopportune states.

original: 'tshod par @270a *//
analyzed: 'tshod par @270a *//
translated: “He will burn” means he will be burned.🔽“He will boil” means he will be boiled.

original: byed / ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: byed / ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “He will fall” means he will fall.🔽Moreover, as long as he does not confess and does not reveal that offense, it will be an obstacle for him in regard to wholesome qualities.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense entailing confession.

original: de la ltung ba ji lta ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji lta ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense?

original: nang gis zin pa dang phyi rol tu 'phangs pa dang de gnyis ka dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nang gis zin pa dang phyi rol tu 'phangs pa dang de gnyis ka dang ldan pas so //
translated: By being seized internally, by being thrown externally, and by both.

original: ji ltar nang gis zin pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar nang gis zin pas she na /
translated: How does one commit an offense by being seized internally?

original: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la sor mo gcig gis rdeg par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la sor mo gcig gis rdeg par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, angry and displeased, strikes a monk with one finger, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang sor mo lngas rdeg par byed na ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang sor mo lngas rdeg par byed na ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one strikes with two, three, or four fingers, there are four or five offenses of wrong conduct.

original: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / bus mo dang / rje ngar dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos rdeg par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / bus mo dang / rje ngar dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos rdeg par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: If one strikes with the fist, elbow, shoulder, head, chest, back, waist, thigh, knee, calf, or even with the toe, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ltar nang gi zin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar nang gi zin pas so //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the offense is accrued in relation to the internal.

original: ji ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas she na /
translated: How is it accrued in relation to the external?

original: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la mdas 'phen par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la mdas 'phen par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, out of anger, throws a weapon at a monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mdas ji lta ba de bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u ka ma dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: mdas ji lta ba de bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u ka ma dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang /
translated: Just as with a weapon, the same applies to an arrow, a half-arrow, a metal arrowhead, a wooden arrowhead, a four-sided arrowhead, a karavīra-leaf-shaped arrowhead, a śaktikā, a spear, a javelin, a club, a stone, a clod of earth, a stick, or a sword.

original: mde'u be'u snying ma dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig dang / rgya shug gi tshig gu dang / tha na @270b yungs kar spar gang 'phen par byed na yungs kar ji snyed lus la phog pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mde'u be'u snying ma dang / 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig dang / rgya shug gi tshig gu dang / tha na @270b yungs kar spar gang 'phen par byed na yungs kar ji snyed lus la phog pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he throws a bullet, a calf-heart, a discus, a single-pointed vajra, a large arrow, a single-pointed weapon, a jujube seed, or even a handful of mustard seeds, then for every mustard seed that strikes the body of the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yungs kar ji snyed lus la ma phog pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yungs kar ji snyed lus la ma phog pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: For every mustard seed that does not strike the body of the other monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas so //
translated: This is because he has thrown them outside.

original: ji ltar de gnyi ga dang ldan pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyi ga dang ldan pas she na /
translated: How does one commit both?

original: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la ral gris 'debs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la ral gris 'debs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, out of anger, throws a sword at another monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ral gris ji lta ba bzhin du shang lang dang ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang / tha na phyags mas rdeg par byed na nyag ma ji snyed lus la phog pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral gris ji lta ba bzhin du shang lang dang ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang / tha na phyags mas rdeg par byed na nyag ma ji snyed lus la phog pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as with a sword, so it is with a spear, a single-edged sword, a double-edged sword, a javelin, a dart, a knife, a blade of grass, or even a straw. For every blade that strikes the body, there is a downfall.

original: nyag ma ji snyed lus la ma phog pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyag ma ji snyed lus la ma phog pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: For every blade that does not strike the body, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ltar gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
translated: Thus, there is a downfall for both.

original: brnangs pa dang thal lcag gi rig sngags grub par byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: brnangs pa dang thal lcag gi rig sngags grub par byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is possessed or insane, or if one is the first offender.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is possessed, insane, or deranged; or if one is suffering from trauma; or if one is the first offender.

original: rdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: rdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-eighth downfall.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na de dag drug sde dag la sten par byed
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na de dag drug sde dag la sten par byed
translated: When the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana had ordained the group of seventeen young men, headed by Upāli, he had them attend on the group of six.

original: / bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: / bsnyen par byed /
translated: They served them,

original: bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: and they waited on them.

original: de @271a *// nas 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: de @271a *// nas 'char kas smras pa /
translated: Then Udayin said,

original: bcu bdun sde dag tshur sheg /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag tshur sheg /
translated: “Come here, Group-of-Seventeen!

original: 'di dang 'di gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di gyis shig /
translated: Do this and that!”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: ci khyod kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
analyzed: ci khyod kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
translated: “Are you our preceptor or teacher?

original: mi byed do //
analyzed: mi byed do //
translated: We won’t do it!”

original: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
analyzed: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
translated: He thought, What are you doing? and he was about to strike one of them, when they all cried out, He's going to strike us!

original: bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
analyzed: bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
translated: He's going to strike us!

original: zhes phyis gan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so //🔽dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: zhes phyis gan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so // dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They all fell down and began to cry.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la brdeg par gzas /🔽'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la brdeg par gzas / 'char kas smras pa /
translated: The monks said, Venerable Udayi, why are you going to strike the young men?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu'o //🔽dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu'o // dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
translated: Udayi said, Venerable sirs, when I was about to strike one of them, they all fell down and cried.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag las gcig la brdeg par gzas na ci'i phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag las gcig la brdeg par gzas na ci'i phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The monks said to the group-of-seven, Venerable sirs, when you were about to strike one of you, why did you all fall down and cry?

original: gal te ma ngus na gang la cis rdeg gtol med do //
analyzed: gal te ma ngus na gang la cis rdeg gtol med do //
translated: They said, If we had not cried, how would we know who was being struck?

original: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas /
translated: “Why are the monks angry, upset, and displeased,🔽and why do they threaten to beat the monks?”

original: dge slong la rdeg par gza' bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong la rdeg par gza' bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: spread it about, and talked about it.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported to the Blessed One the criticism,🔽spread about, and talk.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, the context, and the time, gathered the community of monks.

original: sangs @271b rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs @271b rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, knows and sees.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, asked the venerable Udayin:🔽“Udayin, is it true that you did this?”

original: 'char ka khyod khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas pa bden nam /
analyzed: 'char ka khyod khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas pa bden nam /
translated: “Ākāśa, is it true that you were angry, upset, and displeased, and that you threatened to beat the monk?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Reverend.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha rebuked him,🔽“How can you be angry, upset, and displeased, and threaten to beat a monk?

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: This is not conducive to …🔽the monastic life.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /🔽dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa / tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas / dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This will not lead to …🔽renunciation, leaving home, or becoming homeless.”🔽After rebuking him in many ways,🔽the Blessed One said to the monks, “Therefore, monks, I will establish a training rule for my disciples, the monks, to follow. Having seen ten benefits, I will establish this training rule and readmit the monk Ākāśa: ‘“Monks, you should recite this training rule like this:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: ‘If a monk is angry, upset, and displeased, and threatens to beat a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas na thal mos kyang rung ste ltung byed do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas na thal mos kyang rung ste ltung byed do //
translated: “Monks, if a monk, out of anger and rage, and with a mind of hatred, threatens a monk by saying, ‘I will get you suspended,’ then even if he says, ‘I will get you suspended from what?’ he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: A monk: a monk as described above.

original: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
analyzed: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
translated: Out of anger and rage, and with a mind of hatred: out of anger, and overcome by anger.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: A monk: a fellow monk.

original: brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba ni brdeg par bshams na'o //
analyzed: brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba ni brdeg par bshams na'o //
translated: Threatens: if he threatens by saying, “I will get you suspended,”🔽even if he says, “I will get you suspended from what?”

original: tha na thal mos kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni tha na thal lcag tsam gzas kyang rung ste'o //
analyzed: tha na thal mos kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni tha na thal lcag tsam gzas kyang rung ste'o //
translated: then even if he threatens by saying, “I will get you suspended from the rules of training,”🔽“Offense entailing suspension”: it burns one, it scalds one,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan @272a *//
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan @272a *//
translated: it causes pain to one who is reborn in hell.🔽It burns one, it scalds one,🔽it causes pain to one who is reborn as an animal,🔽it causes pain to one who is reborn in the realm of hungry ghosts,🔽it causes pain to one who is reborn in the unfortunate realms,

original: song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
translated: it causes pain to one who is reborn in the bad destinations,🔽it causes pain to one who is reborn in the lower realms.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is a downfall because it causes one to fall.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, as long as one does not confess and purify that downfall, it obscures one’s virtuous qualities.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: nang gis zin pa dang / phyi rol tu 'phangs pa dang / de gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: nang gis zin pa dang / phyi rol tu 'phangs pa dang / de gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
translated: It is by being inwardly motivated, by being outwardly incited, or by both.

original: ji ltar nang gi zin pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar nang gi zin pas she na /
translated: How is it that one is inwardly motivated?

original: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas /
translated: If a monk, out of anger, becomes upset and displeased,

original: dge slong sor mo gcig gis brdeg par gzas na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong sor mo gcig gis brdeg par gzas na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: and then threatens a monk by raising a finger, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang sor mo lngas brdeg par gzas na ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang sor mo lngas brdeg par gzas na ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he threatens him by raising two, three, four, or all five fingers, he commits five offenses of wrong conduct.

original: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / pus mo dang / rje dar dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos brdeg par gzas na ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / pus mo dang / rje dar dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos brdeg par gzas na ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: If one threatens to strike with one’s fist, elbow, shoulder, head, chest, back, waist, thigh, knee, heel, or even one’s toe, one commits a minor offense.

original: de ltar nang gis zin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar nang gis zin pas so //
translated: Thus, it is an offense if one is in a state of anger.

original: ji ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas she na /🔽dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas she na / dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: How is it an offense if one is angry but does not strike?

original: yi ma rangs nas dge slong la mda' 'phen par gzas par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ma rangs nas dge slong la mda' 'phen par gzas par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk is angry, upset, and furious, and if, out of contempt, he threatens a monk with a weapon, he commits a minor offense.

original: mda' 'phen par gzas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas dang / mde'u ste'u ka ma dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang /
analyzed: mda' 'phen par gzas pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas dang / mde'u ste'u ka ma dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang /
translated: Just as with a weapon, if one threatens with an arrow, an iron arrow, a half-iron arrow, a lead arrow, a cow’s tooth arrow, a four-sided arrow, a karavīra leaf arrow, a reed arrow, a bamboo arrow, a horn arrow, a bone arrow, a wooden arrow, or a stone arrow, one commits a minor offense.

original: mde'u be'u snying ma dang / 'khor lo dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtsa gcig dang / rgya shug gi tshig gu dang / tha na @272b yungs kar spar gang gzas par byed na yungs kar ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mde'u be'u snying ma dang / 'khor lo dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtsa gcig dang / rgya shug gi tshig gu dang / tha na @272b yungs kar spar gang gzas par byed na yungs kar ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: If one threatens to throw a pellet, a single-pointed wheel or vajra, a large arrow, a single-pointed weapon, a jujube seed, or even a handful of mustard seeds, then one commits a downfall equal to the number of mustard seeds threatened.

original: de ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas se //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol tu 'phangs pas se //
translated: Thus, it is a downfall to threaten someone outside the monastic community.

original: ji ltar de gnyi ga dang ldan pas she na /🔽dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyi ga dang ldan pas she na / dge slong khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: How does one commit this downfall through both means?

original: yi ma rangs nas dge slong la ral gris gdab pa gzas par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ma rangs nas dge slong la ral gris gdab pa gzas par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If an angry, enraged, and furious monk threatens a fellow monk with a weapon, he commits a downfall.

original: ral gris ji lta ba de bzhin du shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang / tha na phyags mas brdeg pa gzas par byed na nyag ma ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral gris ji lta ba de bzhin du shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang / tha na phyags mas brdeg pa gzas par byed na nyag ma ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as with a sword, so it is with a spear, a single-edged sword, a double-edged sword, a javelin, a dart, a knife, a blade of grass, or even a straw. If one threatens to strike with as many blades of grass as one has threatened to strike with, one commits as many offenses of wrong conduct.

original: phyags mas ji lta ba bzhin du thur ma'i chag pa dang / thag pa'i chun pos brdeg pa gzas pa yang de bzhin te de ltar gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: phyags mas ji lta ba bzhin du thur ma'i chag pa dang / thag pa'i chun pos brdeg pa gzas pa yang de bzhin te de ltar gnyi ga dang ldan pas so //
translated: Just as with a straw, so it is with a stick or a rope.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or if one is insane, or if one’s mind is disturbed, or if one is in pain because of an illness.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The forty-ninth chapter on the offense entailing confession for threatening is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa'i dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des de ji srid du gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang🔽lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa'i dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa 'gyod pa dang ldan pa bsdams pa bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des de ji srid du gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang lhan cig gnas so //
translated: as long as he did not know that he was engaging in negative tendencies.

original: gang gi tshe des gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe des gnas ngan len kun tu spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
translated: But when he did know that he was engaging in negative tendencies, he began to stay with monks who were naturally restrained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum @273a *//🔽du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum @273a *// du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
translated: By the word of the Blessed One, he went three times a day🔽to bow at his feet.

original: de de'i gan du song ste mkhan po gdugs la spyod du mchi'o //
analyzed: de de'i gan du song ste mkhan po gdugs la spyod du mchi'o //
translated: He went to Nanda and said, “Preceptor, let us go to the midday meal.”

original: zhes zhus pa dang / nye dgas thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa dang / nye dgas thos nas smras pa /
translated: Udayin heard this and said,

original: bu chos kho bo'i stan yang khyer la song zhig /
analyzed: bu chos kho bo'i stan yang khyer la song zhig /
translated: “Son, take my seat and go.”

original: ci slob dpon yang gdugs la spyod du bzhud dam /
analyzed: ci slob dpon yang gdugs la spyod du bzhud dam /
translated: “Is the master also going to the midday meal?”

original: gleng pa khyod kyis kho bo la so sor brtag gam /
analyzed: gleng pa khyod kyis kho bo la so sor brtag gam /
translated: “You are talking nonsense to me.

original: kho bos mi shes pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa gang yod /
analyzed: kho bos mi shes pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa gang yod /
translated: What is the level of a yogin that I do not know?”

original: bdag slob dpon la so sor rtog par mi bgyid de /
analyzed: bdag slob dpon la so sor rtog par mi bgyid de /
translated: “I do not examine the master.

original: 'di ltar ci slob dpon yang gdugs la spyod du bzhud dam zhes zhu bar byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci slob dpon yang gdugs la spyod du bzhud dam zhes zhu bar byas te /
translated: I ask, ‘Master, will you go out for the day’s activities?’

original: gdan 'tshal te mchi'o //
analyzed: gdan 'tshal te mchi'o //
translated: “ ‘I will go, having taken my seat.’

original: des de'i stan khyer te nyin mo spyod du song nas des de'i stan de shing ljon pa'i drung du bzhag ste dben pa'i phyogs su 'dug nas yid la byed pa bskyed par brtsams so //
analyzed: des de'i stan khyer te nyin mo spyod du song nas des de'i stan de shing ljon pa'i drung du bzhag ste dben pa'i phyogs su 'dug nas yid la byed pa bskyed par brtsams so //
translated: “He took his seat and went out for the day’s activities. He placed the seat under a tree and sat down in a secluded place, and began to generate mental attention.

original: de'i 'og tu nye dga' 'ongs nas chos kyis thag ring po kho na nas de mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nye dga' 'ongs nas chos kyis thag ring po kho na nas de mthong nas smras pa /
translated: “Later, Upāli came and saw him from a distance. He said,

original: slob dpon gdan shing ljon pa'i drung du bzhag gi /
analyzed: slob dpon gdan shing ljon pa'i drung du bzhag gi /
translated: ‘Master, your seat is under a tree.

original: der bzhud la bzhugs shig /
analyzed: der bzhud la bzhugs shig /
translated: Go there and sit down.’

original: nye dga' der song nas mgo g-yogs te 'dug pa dang / des der mos pa ma rnyed nas stan las langs te; phyogs bzhir rnam par blta bar brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na bu mo zhig rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral ba mthong nas des chos la /🔽chos rib ma 'dral bar byed do //
analyzed: nye dga' der song nas mgo g-yogs te 'dug pa dang / des der mos pa ma rnyed nas stan las langs te; phyogs bzhir rnam par blta bar brtsams pa dang / ji tsam na bu mo zhig rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral ba mthong nas des chos la / chos rib ma 'dral bar byed do //
translated: When he saw a girl opening the door to the Jetavana, he said,🔽“The Dharma is opening the door to the Dharma.”

original: zhes bos pa dang / chos kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bos pa dang / chos kyis de la smras pa /
translated: Dharma said to him,

original: slob dpon rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi mdo dgongs shig /
analyzed: slob dpon rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi mdo dgongs shig /
translated: “Teacher, please close the door to the Jetavana.”

original: glen pa khyod mdo sde'i mtha' la ston par gyur tam /
analyzed: glen pa khyod mdo sde'i mtha' la ston par gyur tam /
translated: “Fool, have you become a teacher who knows the end of the sūtras?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi rtsva yang yal mi 'dor ro zhes ma @273b gsungs sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi rtsva yang yal mi 'dor ro zhes ma @273b gsungs sam /
translated: Didn’t the Blessed One say, ‘Don’t throw away even a blade of grass belonging to the Saṅgha’?”

original: kho bo rang nyid song la bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo rang nyid song la bzlog par bya'o //
translated: “I will go myself and stop her.”

original: slob dpon nyid mkhyen no //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid mkhyen no //
translated: “The teacher himself knows.”

original: nye dgas song ste smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas song ste smras pa /
translated: Udayin went and said,

original: bu mo khyod ci'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral bar byed /
analyzed: bu mo khyod ci'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral bar byed /
translated: “Girl, why are you opening the door to the Jetavana?”

original: bu mo des 'dzum byung ba dang / nye dgas de yan lag dang nying lag nas mnams te'o byas nas /
analyzed: bu mo des 'dzum byung ba dang / nye dgas de yan lag dang nying lag nas mnams te'o byas nas /
translated: limbs.

original: de chos kyi gan du song ste dris pa /
analyzed: de chos kyi gan du song ste dris pa /
translated: He went to Dharmaruci and asked,

original: bu chos / khyod kyis cung zad mthong ngam /
analyzed: bu chos / khyod kyis cung zad mthong ngam /
translated: “Son Dharmaruci, have you seen anything at all?”

original: slob dpon gzhug pa 'jud pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon gzhug pa 'jud pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: “I have seen everything except for the master’s private parts.”

original: bu chos / su la yang ma zer cig /
analyzed: bu chos / su la yang ma zer cig /
translated: “Son Dharmaruci, don’t tell anyone!”

original: slob dpon / ji srid du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong ma mthong ba de srid kyi bar du su la yang mi mchi'o //

original: chos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyis smras pa /

analyzed: kyis tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' la rmas pa /

analyzed: btsun pa mad do //

original: ci'i phyir de dag gnas ngan len ces bya zhe na /

translated: Dharma said,

original: 'on te zan gcad par 'gyur gtol med do //
analyzed: 'on te zan gcad par 'gyur gtol med do //
translated: “I do not know whether I will eat or fast.”

original: de de gnyis dang lhan cig mnyan yod du zhugs pa dang de gnyis srang du dong ste tshong khang du 'khod nas nye dga' khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste zan zos nas phyir 'ongs so //
analyzed: de de gnyis dang lhan cig mnyan yod du zhugs pa dang de gnyis srang du dong ste tshong khang du 'khod nas nye dga' khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste zan zos nas phyir 'ongs so //
translated: They entered Śrāvastī together, and the two of them went to the market, where they sat down in a shop. Udayin went to the house of that householder, ate his food, and then left.

original: de'i 'og tu dga' bo yang khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste zan za zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dga' bo yang khyim bdag de'i khyim du song ste zan za zhing 'dug go /
translated: After that, Nanda also went to the house of that householder and sat down to eat his food.

original: chos kyis nye dga' la smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyis nye dga' la smras pa /
translated: Dharma then said to Udayin,

original: slob dpon gdugs tshod la bab kyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gdugs tshod la bab kyi /
translated: “Preceptor, it is time for the midday meal.

original: bzhud do // nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: bzhud do // nye dgas smras pa /
translated: Let us go.” Udayin said,

original: der thams cad sta gon byas zin pas der song ste bza' ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba ci yang med kyi /
analyzed: der thams cad sta gon byas zin pas der song ste bza' ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba ci yang med kyi /
translated: “Everything has been prepared there, so there is nothing to do but go there and eat.

original: @276b gdugs tshod kyi kha kho nar 'dong ngo //
analyzed: @276b gdugs tshod kyi kha kho nar 'dong ngo //
translated: Let us go just at noon.”

original: chos langs te /
analyzed: chos langs te /
translated: Dharma got up

original: rkang pa gnyis kyis grib tshod gzhal bar brtsams pa dang / nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyis grib tshod gzhal bar brtsams pa dang / nye dgas smras pa /
translated: and began to measure the shadow with his feet. Udayin said,

original: glen pa khyod kho bo cag gi bslab pa la cung zad yid mi ches sam /
analyzed: glen pa khyod kho bo cag gi bslab pa la cung zad yid mi ches sam /
translated: “Fool, do you not have the slightest faith in our training?

original: ci khyod kyi snying lam na kho bo cag dus ma yin par za bar 'gyur snyam mam /🔽kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
analyzed: ci khyod kyi snying lam na kho bo cag dus ma yin par za bar 'gyur snyam mam / kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
translated: “Do you think I’m going to eat at the wrong time?”

original: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: “It’s not comfortable for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra ba'am /
translated: I’m comfortable talking and sitting by myself.

original: 'dug na bdes khyod song zhig /
analyzed: 'dug na bdes khyod song zhig /
translated: You go away.”

original: chos kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: chos kyis bsams pa /
translated: Dharma thought,

original: gal te bdag gis lhung bzed dang chu tshags khyer te 'ongs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis lhung bzed dang chu tshags khyer te 'ongs par gyur na /
translated: “If I had brought my alms bowl and water filter,

original: bdag bsod snyoms la rgyu bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bdag bsod snyoms la rgyu bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: I would have gone out to beg for alms.

original: da ni ci byar yang med do snyam nas /
analyzed: da ni ci byar yang med do snyam nas /
translated: But now there’s nothing I can do.”🔽He went to the monastery and, as long as his body had luster, he continued to practice virtue. But when the luster left his body, he lay down and slept.

original: de gtsug lag khang du song ste ji srid du de'i lus la mdangs yod pa de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe de'i lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: de gtsug lag khang du song ste ji srid du de'i lus la mdangs yod pa de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe de'i lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to him,🔽“Venerable, why do you sleep?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam ci na ji tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa de tsam gyi zan zos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam ci na ji tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa de tsam gyi zan zos /
translated: “Venerable Dharma, if the food is someone else’s, is the stomach also someone else’s? How much food do you eat that you can’t even take care of your own virtue?”

original: chos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: chos kyis smras pa /
translated: Dharma said,

original: sus zos / khyod kyis ma zos sam /
analyzed: sus zos / khyod kyis ma zos sam /
translated: “Who ate it? Didn’t you eat it?”

original: ma zos so //🔽ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag gis bsam ste /
analyzed: ma zos so // ci'i phyir des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag gis bsam ste /
translated: “I didn’t eat it.”🔽“Why?” He told them what had happened,🔽and the monks with few desires complained and criticized him,

original: dge slong zan gcod du 'jud ces smod @277a *//🔽bar byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong zan gcod du 'jud ces smod @277a *// bar byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: “How could a monk make another monk fast?”

original: kha zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They told the Blessed One what had happened.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, for this cause, for this reason, and on this occasion, assembled the community of monks and addressed the monks:🔽“Monks, a monk should not make another monk fast.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If he does, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, knows and asks.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis nye dga' la rmas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis nye dga' la rmas pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, asked Upāli:

original: nye dga' khyod klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: nye dga' khyod klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: “Upāli, you were looking for an opportunity, thinking, ‘How can I find an opportunity to accuse this monk?’

original: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
analyzed: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
translated: You said to the monk, ‘Venerable, come.

original: khyim dag tu 'dong dang der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas /
analyzed: khyim dag tu 'dong dang der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas /
translated: Let’s go to the houses. There I will give you as much food and drink as you want.’🔽But you did not have him given.

original: khyod kyis de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /🔽'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am / 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am /
translated: After that you said, ‘Venerable, it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'dug na bdes /
analyzed: 'dug na bdes /
translated: It is pleasant for me to talk or sit by myself.

original: khyod song zhig ces zer zhing zan gcod du 'jug pa bden nam /
analyzed: khyod song zhig ces zer zhing zan gcod du 'jug pa bden nam /
translated: “Is it true, as they say, that you went to a house where you were not invited and ate food while fasting?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Reverend.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul @277b dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa / tshul @277b dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them,🔽“How can the renunciants, the sons of the Śākya, act in this way?🔽This is not in accordance with the Dharma, not in accordance with the Vinaya, and not in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction.

original: zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: This is not something that should be done by the renunciants.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: After rebuking them in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
translated: “Therefore, monks, I have seen ten benefits in establishing training rules for the disciples in the training of the Vinaya.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.🔽My disciples should recite this training rule:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My śrāvakas should recite this basis of training in the Vinaya:

original: yang dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If a monk, seeking an opportunity, thinks, ‘In any case, I will find an opportunity with this monk,’

original: snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: and makes that the reason

original: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
analyzed: dge slong la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
translated: to say to a monk, ‘Venerable, come!

original: khyim dag tu 'dong dang der khyed la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go /🔽zhes smras nas /
analyzed: khyim dag tu 'dong dang der khyed la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go / zhes smras nas /
translated: Let us go to the houses of householders, where we will be given as much fresh and cooked food as we want.’

original: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /🔽'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am /
analyzed: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am / 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am /
translated: If, after he has not caused him to be given anything, he then says to him, ‘Venerable, it is not pleasant for me to talk or stay with you.

original: 'dug na bdes khyod song zhig ces zer na ltung byed do //
analyzed: 'dug na bdes khyod song zhig ces zer na ltung byed do //
translated: It is pleasant for me to stay by myself. You go away,’🔽then that monk too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If a monk” means that

original: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: it refers to the Śākya-son Upāli

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or any other such monk.

original: klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽ci nas kyang dge slong 'di'i zan gcod @278a *//
analyzed: klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni / ci nas kyang dge slong 'di'i zan gcod @278a *//
translated: He will seek out a fault, thinking, How can I find fault with this monk?

original: du bcug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: du bcug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: He will seek out a fault, thinking, How can I deprive this monk of food?

original: de nyid rkyen du byas te /🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du byas te / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Taking that as a condition,

original: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: means not otherwise.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: To a monk means to one who is a member of this Dharma.

original: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
translated: As it is said, Having said this,

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog /
translated: Come, venerable one, let us go to the houses.

original: khyim dag tu 'dong dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //🔽der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lda dang bza' ba lda'o //
analyzed: khyim dag tu 'dong dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o // der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lda dang bza' ba lda'o //
translated: means to the houses of brahmins and householders.🔽 There, means there, in those houses,🔽 as much as you wish means as much as you like.

original: ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having said, I will give you

original: ji tsam gyis chog par ro //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis chog par ro //
translated: whatever you want,

original: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
analyzed: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo la khyod dang lhan cig smra ba'am /
translated: After that, he says, “Venerable, it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am /🔽'dug na bdes khyod song zhig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am / 'dug na bdes khyod song zhig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is pleasant for me to talk or sit alone.🔽You go away.”🔽“Says” means if he says this.

original: de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: “Offense” means🔽to burn,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni /🔽sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni / sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: to cook,🔽and to fall into the hells, the animal realm,

original: 'tshod par byed /🔽ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshod par byed / ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: and the ghost realm—into bad rebirths, bad destinies, and downfall.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and is not disclosed, it is an obscuration to virtuous qualities.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense?

original: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad ched du bsams te /
analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad ched du bsams te /
translated: A monk, to whatever extent he intentionally

original: dge slong gis zan @278b gcod du 'jud na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis zan @278b gcod du 'jud na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk makes someone else fast, he commits an offense entailing confession in all cases.🔽There is no offense if he makes a sick person fast;

original: nad pa'i byed du 'jug pa dang / sman pas bstan pa byed du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nad pa'i byed du 'jug pa dang / sman pas bstan pa byed du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if he makes someone fast who is being treated by a doctor;🔽if he is a beginning practitioner;

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if he is insane; if his mind is disturbed; if he is in pain.

original: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gcig pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gcig pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The fifty-first chapter on “Making Someone Fast” is concluded.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Jetavana, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park near Śrāvastī.

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then many merchants from Śrāvastī went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /🔽mtha' cig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te / mtha' cig tu 'khod do //
translated: Having arrived, they bowed low until their foreheads touched the Blessed One’s feet,🔽and then they sat down to one side.

original: mtha' cig tu 'khod nas /
analyzed: mtha' cig tu 'khod nas /
translated: Having sat down to one side,

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: enthused, and delighted the many merchants of Śrāvastī with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: yang dag par 'dzin tu 'jud par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //🔽rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin tu 'jud par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do // rnam grangs du mas chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: Having instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: enthused, and delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma in a variety of ways, he remained silent.

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong ba rab tu mang po dag gis /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par @279a *//🔽dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong ba rab tu mang po dag gis / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par @279a *// dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Then the many merchants of Śrāvastī🔽rejoiced in and praised the words of the Blessed One.🔽They bowed low until their foreheads touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas dong nas /
