original: sa mkhan ltar lam du zhugs pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽ded dpon ltar tshong pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽tshong dpon ltar 'khor gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: sa mkhan ltar lam du zhugs pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / ded dpon ltar tshong pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / tshong dpon ltar 'khor gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a group of travelers, like a guide.🔽He was surrounded by a group of merchants, like a caravan leader.🔽He was surrounded by a group of attendants, like a guild master.

original: mkhar gyi rgyal po ltar blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: mkhar gyi rgyal po ltar blon po'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a group of ministers, like a king of a city.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ltar bu stong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ltar bu stong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of a thousand sons, like a universal monarch.

original: zla ba ltar rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: zla ba ltar rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of stars, like the moon.

original: nyi ma ltar 'od zer stong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽yul 'khor srung ltar dri za'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: nyi ma ltar 'od zer stong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / yul 'khor srung ltar dri za'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of a thousand light rays, like the sun.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of gandharvas, like Dhritarashtra.

original: 'phags skyes po ltar grul bum gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽mig mi bzang ltar klu'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: 'phags skyes po ltar grul bum gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / mig mi bzang ltar klu'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of kumbhāṇḍas, like Virūpākṣa.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of nāgas, like Virūḍhaka.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of yakṣas, like Kubera.

original: nor sbyin ltar gnod sbyin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽thags bzang ris ltar lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /🔽brgya byin ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: nor sbyin ltar gnod sbyin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / thags bzang ris ltar lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba / brgya byin ltar sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of asuras, like Bali.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of the gods of the Thirty-Three, like Śakra.🔽He was surrounded by a retinue of the gods of the class of the Four Great Kings, like the Four Great Kings.

original: tshangs pa ltar tshangs ris kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: tshangs pa ltar tshangs ris kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, like the Thirty-Three.

original: dbang po rnams shin tu dul ba spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa chu gter ltar ting nge ba /
analyzed: dbang po rnams shin tu dul ba spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa chu gter ltar ting nge ba /
translated: His senses were very well disciplined, his behavior and conduct were undisturbed, and he was as still as an ocean.

original: sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa /
translated: He was like a cloud with water,

original: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dang @282b bral ba /
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dang @282b bral ba /
translated: and like an elephant king free from arrogance.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He was well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: and his body was beautified with the eighty minor marks.

original: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
translated: He was adorned with a fathom of light,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: and his radiance was greater than a thousand suns.

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
translated: He was completely good, like a moving mountain of jewels,

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: and he possessed the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the three unique recollections, and great compassion.

original: kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / grags pa dang / gang bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzang la sogs pa nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
analyzed: kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / grags pa dang / gang bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzang la sogs pa nyan thos chen po de dag dang /
translated: Kauṇḍinya, Aśvajit, Bhadrika, Vāṣpa, Mahānāman, Yaśas, Revata, Śuddhipanthaka, Gopaka, Subāhu, and so forth,

original: gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun rab tu mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun rab tu mang pos yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te /
translated: and a great saṅgha of many monks.

original: rgyal po'i khab ga la ba der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ga la ba der logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
translated: He went on a journey to Rājagṛha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo don mthun gyi mdun du song ba dang / ji tsam na lam kha brag mthong nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo don mthun gyi mdun du song ba dang / ji tsam na lam kha brag mthong nas /
translated: The venerable Ānanda went ahead of the caravan, and when he saw a narrow path,

original: des bcom ldan 'das ma gshegs kyi bar du der bsdad do //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das ma gshegs kyi bar du der bsdad do //
translated: he stayed there until the Blessed One had passed.

original: bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had passed,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo khyod ci sdod /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod ci sdod /
translated: “Ānanda, why are you staying here?”

original: btsun pa 'di ni shul kha brag lags te /
analyzed: btsun pa 'di ni shul kha brag lags te /
translated: “Lord, this is a narrow path,

original: shul 'di ni drang la seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bcas pa lags /
analyzed: shul 'di ni drang la seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bcas pa lags /
translated: This path is straight, but it is dangerous because of lions.

original: shul 'di ni 'khyog la bde ba lags na shul gang nas mchi bar bgyi /
analyzed: shul 'di ni 'khyog la bde ba lags na shul gang nas mchi bar bgyi /
translated: This path is crooked, but it is safe. Which path should we take?”

original: kun dga' bo lam @283a *//
analyzed: kun dga' bo lam @283a *//
translated: “Ānanda,

original: drang po nas song zhig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: drang po nas song zhig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: take the straight path, for the Tathāgata is free from the danger of lions.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das shul drang po nas gshegs par brtsams nas ji tsam na lam de na ri brags shig yod pa der byon pa dang / ri brags de nas byis pa khye'u gnyis shig lam kar 'ongs te rtse zhing 'dug go /🔽de nas gcig gi lag na ni rnga pa ta ha thogs /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das shul drang po nas gshegs par brtsams nas ji tsam na lam de na ri brags shig yod pa der byon pa dang / ri brags de nas byis pa khye'u gnyis shig lam kar 'ongs te rtse zhing 'dug go / de nas gcig gi lag na ni rnga pa ta ha thogs /
translated: Then the Blessed One began to travel by the straight path. When they reached a village on that path, two boys came out onto the road while playing and were standing there.🔽One of them had a paṭaha drum in his hand,

original: cig shos kyi lag na ni gzhu thogs so //
analyzed: cig shos kyi lag na ni gzhu thogs so //
translated: and the other had a bow.

original: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das mthong nas 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das mthong nas 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs su gsol /
translated: When they saw the Blessed One, they said this:🔽“Blessed One, please come here!

original: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so //
translated: Blessed One, welcome!”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i shul du gar gshegs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i shul du gar gshegs /
translated: “Where will the Blessed One go in this fearful place?

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das mi bsnyengs su gsol /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das mi bsnyengs su gsol /
translated: But please, Blessed One, do not be afraid.

original: bdag cag gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sel bgyi'o //🔽de na dad pa skyes pa gcig gis ni rnga pa ta ha brdungs /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi sel bgyi'o // de na dad pa skyes pa gcig gis ni rnga pa ta ha brdungs /
translated: We two will carry the Blessed One.”🔽One of them, who had faith, beat a paṭaha drum.

original: dad pa skyes pa cig shog kyis ni gzhu brdungs te /
analyzed: dad pa skyes pa cig shog kyis ni gzhu brdungs te /
translated: One of them, who had faith, beat a bow.

original: de gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'gro bar brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'gro bar brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: They began to go in front of the Blessed One, and the Blessed One thought,

original: khye'u 'di gnyis kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed do snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: khye'u 'di gnyis kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed do snyam du rig nas /
translated: “These two boys have planted roots of virtue.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u de gnyis la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u de gnyis la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Knowing this, the Blessed One said to the two boys,

original: khye'u gnyis phyir log cig /
analyzed: khye'u gnyis phyir log cig /
translated: “Boys, turn back.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng @283b ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng @283b ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is free from the fear of lions.”

original: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas dong ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas dong ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One smiled.

original: chos nyid kyi na gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dzum pa mdzad pa de'i tshe na zhal nas 'od zer sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang / btsod ka dang shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung nas /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi na gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'dzum pa mdzad pa de'i tshe na zhal nas 'od zer sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dang / btsod ka dang shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung nas /
translated: It is the nature of things that when the blessed buddhas smile, blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, and silver-colored rays emanate from their mouths.

original: kha cig ni 'og logs su 'dong /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'og logs su 'dong /
translated: Some of them go down and some go up.

original: kha cig ni steng logs su 'dong bas gang dag 'og logs su 'dong ba de dag ni sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tshab dang / rab tu tsha ba dang /
analyzed: kha cig ni steng logs su 'dong bas gang dag 'og logs su 'dong ba de dag ni sems can dmyal ba yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus gzhom dang / ngu 'bod dang / ngu 'bod chen po dang / tshab dang / rab tu tsha ba dang /
translated: Those that go down go to the Reviving Hell, the Black Line Hell, the Crushing Hell, the Howling Hell, the Great Howling Hell, the Hot Hell, and the Extremely Hot Hell.

original: mnar med pa dang / chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so tham tham pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa chen por dong ste /🔽sems can dmyal ba tsha ba gang dag yin pa de dag tu ni bsil bar gyur te 'bab par byed la /
analyzed: mnar med pa dang / chu bur can dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so tham tham pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpa la ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa dang / pad ma ltar gas pa chen por dong ste / sems can dmyal ba tsha ba gang dag yin pa de dag tu ni bsil bar gyur te 'bab par byed la /
translated: They go to the Avīci, the Saṃjīva, the Kālasūtra, the Saṃghāta, the Raurava, the Mahāraurava, the Tapana, the Pratāpana, and the Avīci hells.🔽In the hot hells, they become cool;

original: sems can dmyal ba grang ba gang dag yin pa de dag tu ni dro bar gyur te 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba grang ba gang dag yin pa de dag tu ni dro bar gyur te 'bab par byed do //
translated: in the cold hells, they become warm.

original: des sems can de dag gi gnod pa'i bye brag gang dag rgyun gcod par byed cing /
analyzed: des sems can de dag gi gnod pa'i bye brag gang dag rgyun gcod par byed cing /
translated: They stop the particular torments of those sentient beings.

original: de dag 'di snyam du shes ldan dag /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du shes ldan dag /
translated: Those sentient beings think, “Sirs,

original: ci bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos sam /
analyzed: ci bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos sam /
translated: have we died and transmigrated from here?

original: @284a *// 'on te gzhan du skyes snyam du sems so //
analyzed: @284a *// 'on te gzhan du skyes snyam du sems so //
translated: Or have we been born somewhere else?”

original: de dag dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa gtong bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de dag dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa gtong bar mdzad de /
translated: In order to generate faith in them, the Blessed One sends forth a magical emanation.

original: de dag gis sprul pa mthong nas 'di snyam du shes ldan dag bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis sprul pa mthong nas 'di snyam du shes ldan dag bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Having seen the emanation, they think, “Sirs, we have not died and passed away from here,

original: gzhan du skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor have we been born elsewhere.

original: 'di ltar sems can sngon ma mthong ba 'di'i mthus bdag cag gi gnod pa'i bye brag dag rgyun chad par gyur to snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can sngon ma mthong ba 'di'i mthus bdag cag gi gnod pa'i bye brag dag rgyun chad par gyur to snyam du sems so //
translated: However, by the power of this being who has never been seen before, the particular sufferings have been cut off for us.”

original: de dag sprul pa la sems mngon par dad par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag sprul pa la sems mngon par dad par gyur nas /
translated: Having become faithful to the emanation,

original: sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de zad par byas nas /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de zad par byas nas /
translated: they exhaust the karma that would have caused them to experience the hells.

original: gang du bden pa dag gi snod du gyur pa 'gyur ba'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor ba len par byed do //
analyzed: gang du bden pa dag gi snod du gyur pa 'gyur ba'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor ba len par byed do //
translated: They then take rebirth among gods and humans who are suitable vessels for the truths.

original: gang dag steng logs su 'dong ba de dag ni rgyal chen bzhi pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang /
analyzed: gang dag steng logs su 'dong ba de dag ni rgyal chen bzhi pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang /
translated: the Thirty-three, the Yamas, the Tusitas, the Nirmāṇaratis, the Paranirmitavaśavartins, the Brahmakāyikas, the Brahmapurohitas,

original: tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang / dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang /
translated: the Mahābrahmans, the Parīttābhās, the Apramāṇābhās, the Ābhāsvaras, the Parīttaśubhas, the Apramāṇaśubhas, the Śubhakṛtsnas, the Anabhrakas, the Puṇyaprasavas, the Bṛhatphalas, the Avṛhas,

original: mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du dong nas mi rtag @284b pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sgrogs par byed cing /
analyzed: mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi nang du dong nas mi rtag @284b pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sgrogs par byed cing /
translated: the Atapa, the Sudarśanas, the Sudṛśas, and the Akaniṣṭha gods, and they proclaim the words impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po /
translated: They proclaim the two verses:

original: brtsams par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: brtsams par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
translated: I will compose and I will arise.

original: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya /
translated: I will enter the teaching of the Buddha.

original: 'dam bu'i khyim du glang chen bzhin /
analyzed: 'dam bu'i khyim du glang chen bzhin /
translated: Like an elephant in a house of reeds,

original: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya //
translated: I will destroy the army of the Lord of Death.

original: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
translated: Whoever practices with utmost heedfulness

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
translated: In this Dharma and Vinaya

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: Will abandon the cycle of birth

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba yang smras so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba yang smras so //
translated: And make an end to suffering.

original: de nas 'od zer de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams byul nas /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer de dag gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams byul nas /
translated: Then those light rays, having circled the trichiliocosm,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi slad bzhin slad bzhin du rjes su 'dong ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi slad bzhin slad bzhin du rjes su 'dong ste /
translated: followed behind the Blessed One.

original: de la gal te bcom ldan 'das 'das pa'i las lung ston par bzhed na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi snam logs su nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te bcom ldan 'das 'das pa'i las lung ston par bzhed na ni bcom ldan 'das kyi snam logs su nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Blessed One wished to prophesy past karma, they would disappear into the Blessed One’s back.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i las lung ston par bzhed na ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i las lung ston par bzhed na ni /
translated: If he wished to prophesy future karma,

original: mdun logs su nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdun logs su nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: they would disappear into his front.

original: sems can dmyal bar skye ba lung ston par bzhed na ni zhabs kyi mthil du nub par 'gyur ro //🔽dud 'gror skye ba lung ston par bzhed na ni long bur nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skye ba lung ston par bzhed na ni zhabs kyi mthil du nub par 'gyur ro // dud 'gror skye ba lung ston par bzhed na ni long bur nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he wishes to predict an animal rebirth, it disappears into his heel.

original: yi dvags su skye bar lung ston par bzhed na ni zhabs kyi mthe bor nub par 'gyur /🔽mir skye ba lung ston par bzhed na ni /
